0.title: Amazon facing $1 billion lawsuit in UK for 'favouring own products'
0.article_body: Amazon is facing a UK lawsuit for damages of up to Â£900 million ($1 billion) over allegations that the firm abused its dominant position by favouring its own products. Consumer rights advocate Julie Hunter plans to bring the collective action on behalf of British consumers who have made purchases on Amazon since October 2016. Case is "without merit", Amazon said.

1.title: Four killed in an explosion in a house in Madhya Pradesh
1.article_body: Four people, including three of a family, were killed and seven others were injured in an explosion in a house in Banmore town, Madhya Pradesh, on Thursday. The house collapsed after the blast. While some crackers were found in the house's godown, the quantity was not enough to be certain it caused the blast, an official said.

2.title: Depriving Ganguly to fight ICC elections shameless political vendetta: Mamata
2.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday called Sourav Ganguly not getting support from BCCI for the ICC chief's election a "shameless political vendetta". Banerjee said that the move was made to secure someone else's interests, adding that she spoke to several BJP leaders, but Ganguly wasn't allowed. Banerjee had previously sought PM Modi's intervention.

3.title: Aap Cong ki girawat par dhyan do: BJP as Kharge tweets on falling rupee
3.article_body: After newly elected Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge tweeted about rupee depreciation, BJP's Amit Malviya said, "Aap Congress ki girawat par dhyan do, jo desh mein lagbhag simat chuki hain (You focus on downfall of Congress, which has almost come to a standstill in the country)." Malviya said the government and RBI are taking "appropriate steps" to address the falling rupee.

4.title: Philippines should honour helicopters' purchase deal: Russian Ambassador
4.article_body: Russia's Ambassador to the Philippines Marat Pavlov said Manila should honour the contract of buying 16 Russian-made military helicopters, amidst reports that former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte had cancelled the deal fearing US sanctions. Pavlov said the Philippine government has not notified Russia of the cancellation. He said a Russian company has begun manufacturing the helicopters.

5.title: Assam govt withdraws AFSPA from West Karbi Anglong district
5.article_body: The Assam government has removed the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act from one more district, West Karbi Anglong, with effect from October 1. The Act still covers eight districts bordering Arunachal Pradesh and Nagaland and a sub-division bordering Manipur. The eight districts are Tinsukia, Dibrugarh, Charaideo, Sivasagar, Jorhat, Golaghat, Karbi Anglong and Dima Hasao.

6.title: BJP, TRS trying to create WB-like situation in T'gana: Cong's Revanth Reddy
6.article_body: Telangana Congress chief A Revanth Reddy on Wednesday claimed that BJP and TRS were conspiring to do a similar experiment in Telangana, which was conducted in West Bengal, by resorting to violence in Munugode constituency. Reddy claimed that CM K Chandrashekar Rao is planning to visit Munugode with a massive convoy and there is possibility of unrest after his visit.

7.title: US startup's flying car gets $3 mn from Tesla investor
7.article_body: California-based Alef Aeronautics, which makes flying cars, has attracted prominent venture capitalist Tim Draper. Draper, an early investor in Tesla and SpaceX, has invested $3 million in Alef through his Draper Associates Fund V. Jim Dukhovny, Founder of Alef Aeronautics, said he put more money in after Draper's investment and after seeing a small drone prototype.

8.title: Bengaluru IPS officer Nisha James transferred following allegations of harassment
8.article_body: IPS officer Nisha James has been transferred, days after police personnel in Bengaluru alleged she was harassing them, officials said on Thursday. James, who was Deputy Commissioner of Police, Administration, Bengaluru City Police, has been made Superintendent of Police, Internal Security Division. Senior police officers said a departmental inquiry will be initiated in the matter.

9.title: JeM chief Masood Azhar charged in J&K terror attack before PM's visit
9.article_body: The NIA on Wednesday filed a chargesheet against Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) chief Maulana Masood Azhar, his brother Rouf Asghar Alvi and 10 others in the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Sunjuwan in April 2022. The attack took place two days before PM Narendra Modi's visit to Jammu. The NIA said JeM terrorists had infiltrated into India for disrupting PM's visit.

10.title: House in Bihar washes away in Ganga due to erosion; video surfaces
10.article_body: A video of a house in Bihar's Bhagalpur getting washed away in Ganga river due to erosion has surfaced online. "If there's damage to house due to erosion, we'll provide financial help to repair the house to concerned beneficiaries after getting the records approved," District Magistrate SK Sen said. Several houses have reportedly been washed away in past few days.

11.title: JP Nadda to chair Rajasthan BJP core committee meeting on Friday
11.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda will hold Rajasthan BJP core committee meeting in Delhi on Friday to discuss about the preparations for the upcoming 2023 Assembly elections. Union Ministers from Rajasthan, Rajasthan BJP President Satish Poonia, Leader of the Opposition in Rajasthan Assembly Gulab Chand Kataria will be present in the meeting. State leaders will give feedback about the current situation.

12.title: LIC to recover its investment in IDBI Bank by time of sale: Official
12.article_body: An official said LIC is expected to recover the â¹21,624 crore it invested in IDBI Bank. The official claimed that share prices will likely rebound to 2019 levels by the time the lender is privatised. According to the official, IDBI's share price has jumped from â¹35 a share to â¹45 a piece, since the privatisation process started.

13.title: Candle light march in Noida after infant mauled to death by stray dog
13.article_body: Residents of a housing society in Noida's sector 100 carried out a candle march protest on Wednesday night after a seven-month-old child was mauled to death by a stray dog at an apartment building. The angry residents protested against the authorities for failing to provide shelters for stray dogs. "We cannot leave our children to die," a resident said.

14.title: Axis Bank reports 70% YoY increase in Q2 net profit at â¹5,330 crore
14.article_body: Axis Bank reported a 70% year-on-year (YoY) rise in its net profit to reach â¹5,329.77 crore for quarter ending September 2022. Net profit grew 29% quarter-on-quarter, while net interest income (NII) went up by 31% YoY to â¹10,360.3 crore. Its provisions stood at â¹549.78 crore in Q2 FY23, which is a fall of 68% from â¹1,735 crore in Q2 FY22.

15.title: Video shows NCP's Supriya Sule exiting car to clear traffic in Pune
15.article_body: A video has gone viral on the internet, showing NCP leader Supriya Sule exiting her car to clear traffic in Pune. In the video, Sule can be seen guiding the drivers to make way for clearing the traffic in Hadapsar. "Top priority should be given to Palkhi Highway from Hadapsar to Saswad," she said in a tweet.

16.title: Was replaced in 'Saaya' just after 1 shot, thought my life was over: Katrina
16.article_body: Katrina Kaif revealed that she was replaced in Anurag Basu's film 'Saaya' just after shooting one shot. "Not one day but just one shot...at that time I thought...my life was over...my career was over," Katrina said. "I've had people, to my face, say when I first started out that you cannot be an actor...there's nothing good about you," she added.

17.title: BBMP considers terminating contract of pothole filling agency
17.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) officials said they are considering terminating American Road Technology and Solutions' contract as the civic body's pothole filling agency. The development comes after a woman died earlier in the week in an accident on a pothole-riddled road in the city. "We have issued two notices to the company," said BBMP Chief Engineer (Projects) M Lokesh.

18.title: PhonePe is investing $200 million on data centres: Co-founder Rahul Chari
18.article_body: PhonePe's Co-founder and Chief Technology Officer Rahul Chari said the company is investing $200 million on building data centres in India. He added that the investments are driven by the regulatory insistence on data localisation. He said the company has already invested $150 million but did not specify a timeline for investing the remaining $50 million.

19.title: Mumbai student cheated of â¹44,200 after ordering 30,000 eggs for business
19.article_body: A 22-year-old commerce student was allegedly cheated of â¹44,200 in Mumbai. Ajay Gupta found the accused, Gurmeet Singh, on Justdial in September 2021 and ordered 30,000 eggs from him for his wholesale business. He had paid him â¹44,200. Later, Singh asked him to pay â¹42,750 more for 'insurance'. When Gupta refused and asked for a refund, Singh declined his request.

20.title: Not just future of Shiv Sena, but Indian democracy at stake: Uddhav
20.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said that not only the future of the Shiv Sena but democracy in India is at stake. He is fighting a legal battle over the legacy of the party founded by his father late Bal Thackeray. "My future and that of my party will be decided by the people and the party cadre," Uddhav said.

21.title: 4 police officers torture soldier, his brother over fake case in Kerala; suspended
21.article_body: A total of four policemen in Kerala's Kollam were suspended on Thursday on charges of torturing two brothers, including a soldier, after fabricating a case against them. The alleged torture came to light after the 30-year-old and 25-year-old brothers were released from judicial custody. "When we pleaded for water, they asked us to drink urine," one of the brothers said.

22.title: 1 face before us, 1 before media: Mistry on Tharoor over 'irregularities' claim
22.article_body: Congress' Central Election Authority chief Madhusudan Mistry criticised Shashi Tharoor over his allegations of "irregularities" remark, saying that he had "one face before us and another before the media". "We accommodated your request and despite that, you went to the media alleging the Central Election Authority was conspiring against you," Mistry said.

23.title: Coal import to be stopped by 2024: Coal Minister
23.article_body: Coal Minister Pralhad Joshi said that the import of coal, which has declined considerably, will be stopped by 2024. Speaking at an event to release a 'Compendium of Asset Accounts on Mineral and Energy Resources', the minister said the report presents comprehensive picture of the mineral resources spread across different states in the country.

24.title: People put AC on 17Â°C and use a blanket: PM while speaking on climate change
24.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while speaking on climate change, stressed that "climate change goes beyond policy making". He said, "Some people prefer to keep the air conditioner's temperature at 17Â°C or 18Â°C and these same people then use a blanket too." He added that with each dropping temperature, the energy consumption increases and the adverse effect on the environment also increases.

25.title: Celebrity engagement firm Tring raises $5 mn in pre-Series A round
25.article_body: Celebrity engagement platform Tring raised $5 million in a pre-Series A funding round led by Kalaari Capital and saw participation from Blume Founders Fund, Redbrook Pte (Singapore) and Sujeet Kumar (Udaan.com). Kalaari Capital invested $2 million and has an option to invest $2.5 million later. Tring was founded by Akshay Saini, Rahul Saini and Pranav Chabhadia to improve celebrity-fan engagement.

26.title: Foxconn delays Bharat FIH's IPO due to current market conditions
26.article_body: Foxconn Technology Group said it has decided to push the plans for floating â¹5,000 crore IPO for the India unit Bharat FIH forward in light of the market conditions. Foxconn said a proposed spinoff would be pursued when conditions improve. Bharat FIH, a subsidiary of FIH Mobiles and a Foxconn Technology Group company, makes devices for Xiaomi and Nokia.

27.title: Who are India's top 10 philanthropists according to Hurun?
27.article_body: HCL Tech's Shiv Nadar & family have topped Hurun India Philanthropy List 2022 with donations totalling â¹1,161 crore. They're followed by Wipro's Azim Premji & family with â¹484 crore in donations. The Premji family is followed by Mukesh Ambani & family. Kumar Mangalam Birla & family were ranked 4th, followed by Susmita and Subroto Bagchi and Radha & NS Parthasarathy.

28.title: China holds emergency talks with chip firms over US curbs: Report
28.article_body: Chinese government convened emergency meetings over the past week with leading semiconductor firms, seeking to assess the damage from US' newly-imposed chip sanctions, according to reports. Executives from firms like Yangtze Memory Technologies and Dawning Information Industry were summoned to attend the closed-door meetings. Many executives said the sanctions will be disastrous for the industry.

29.title: US-based Tribe Capital to invest $2 bn in Indian startups in 2 years
29.article_body: US-headquartered venture capital firm Tribe Capital will invest $2 billion across Indian startups in the next two years. Founded in 2018, the firm has three venture capital funds, along with two funds investing in crypto and token-based opportunities. CEO and Co-founder Arjun Sethi said, "Currently, we have $1.5 billion Assets Under Management (AUM) of which 20% is in India."

30.title: Girl mistakes exam chit as love letter, her family kills Class 5 boy in Bihar
30.article_body: A 12-year-old boy was reportedly chopped to death by a girl's family after she mistook his exam 'chit' as love letter in Bihar. Narrating the incident, police said, "The boy threw a chit at his sister to help her...However, the chit fell near another girl...who thought it to be a love letter. After...exam, she conveyed the message to her brothers."

31.title: Gangster Atiq Ahmad calls UP CM Adityanath 'brave'; video surfaces
31.article_body: A video showing gangster Atiq Ahmad praising Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has surfaced online. In the video, Ahmad can be seen saying, "Yogi Adityanath ek imaandaar mukhyamantri hain aur bohot bahadur hain (Yogi Adityanath is an honest and very brave CM)." Ahmad said this while he was being taken to a CBI court in Lucknow for a hearing.

32.title: UK Prime Minister Liz Truss resigns after 45 days in office
32.article_body: Liz Truss has resigned as UK Prime Minister after 45 days in office amid massive economic crisis, becoming the shortest-serving leader in British history. Conservatives will choose a new UK leader within a week, Truss said in her resignation statement. She had defeated Indian-origin Rishi Sunak in the UK PM race.

33.title: 'No shame...read history: Gehlot to BJP over 'rubber stamp' remark on Kharge
33.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot criticised BJP MP Rajyavardhan Rathore over his "rubber stamp" remark on Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge and said that the party should "read history". Gehlot said that BJP leaders have "no shame". Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij on Wednesday said that Congress Presidential polls were elections for "Gandhi family's remote".

34.title: Choose between AAP-nirbhar or Atmanirbhar: Shah ahead of Delhi MCD polls
34.article_body: Ahead of the Delhi MCD polls, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that people will have to decide if they want to be "AAP-nirbhar or Atmanirbhar". "People should also decide if they like 'prachaar' (campaign) politics or 'parivartan' (change) politics," Shah added. He accused the Kejriwal government of "step-motherly treatment" to civic bodies and said it owed them â¹40,000 crore.

35.title: MP man kills neighbour for interfering in fight with his wife over 'mutton'
35.article_body: A man killed his 45-year-old neighbour for interfering in a fight with his wife over cooking 'mutton' in MP on Tuesday. The accused had purchased meat and had plans of cooking it, however, his wife objected to it, saying it was a Tuesday. The deceased intervened after hearing noises, following which the accused hit him with a heavy stick.

36.title: SEBI clears Centre's proposal to turn Vodafone Idea dues into equity: Report
36.article_body: Market regulator SEBI has cleared Centre's proposal to convert Vodafone Idea's (Vi) dues of over $1.92 billion into equity, Reuters reported. SEBI has also approved Centre's request to classify its shareholding in the telecom operator as public float and has communicated its decisions to the telecom ministry. Centre's stake in Vi after the conversion could be over 30%.

37.title: Bombay HC issues notice to PMC over PIL on water scarcity in Pune
37.article_body: The Bombay High Court issued a notice to nine government organisations, including the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC), over a petition filed about water scarcity in the city. Justices SV Gangapurwala and RN Laddha heard the PIL filed by residents of urban areas of Pune. Petitioners alleged that all the dams and reservoirs are 100% full yet water doesn't reach residents.

38.title: Pune civic body to make management reports for roads in the city
38.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will appoint a technical consultant to prepare maintenance management reports for the city roads. "The PMC will carry out inspection of all roads with width above 12 metre in the city limits," a civic body official said. The parameters for inspection will include pothole areas, pothole depth, pavement conditions among other things, the official added.

39.title: Our biggest achievement: Kejriwal as PM Modi visits school in Guj
39.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi visited a government school in Gujarat, Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal said, "This is our biggest achievement." "I'm...very happy that today all the parties...have to talk about education and schools...I hope that education is not missed only during elections," Kejriwal added. He also shared a picture of PM Modi sitting in a classroom.

40.title: Rachakonda Police bust cricket betting racket, 4 persons arrested
40.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police busted a cricket betting racket and arrested four persons in connection with the case. The police seized â¹6 lakh in cash, four mobile phones, along with frozen amount of â¹10.71 lakh in two ICICI bank accounts belonging to two of the accused. The bookie, Uddaraju Sathish Raju, is currently absconding, police stated.

41.title: Over 28,000 kg fake cumin made from stone powder seized in Delhi
41.article_body: Delhi Police's Crime Branch has seized over 28,000 kilograms of fake cumin in an illegal factory in Delhi's Rohini. Police have arrested Suresh Gupta, the owner of the factory. According to police, fake cumin is made using wild grass, jaggery vinegar and stone powder and then these fake seeds are mixed with the real ones and sold in the market.

42.title: UAE win a match in T20 World Cup for the first time in history
42.article_body: UAE defeated Namibia by seven runs in their last Group A first round match of T20 World Cup 2022. It's UAE's first-ever victory in T20 World Cup history. Despite their win, UAE finished last on Group A points table. Namibia and UAE have been eliminated from the tournament. Sri Lanka and Netherlands have advanced to Super 12s from Group A.

43.title: Voting direction clear: Cong on Rahul declaring party chief before results
43.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said "erroneous" reports claimed that Congress MP Rahul Gandhi announced Mallikarjun Kharge as the new party President before the result of the party election was out. "The direction of voting was quite clear," he added. At a press conference on Wednesday, Rahul had said, "I can't comment on the Congress President's role, that's for...Kharge...to comment on."

44.title: Delhivery's stock drops by 14% on moderate shipment growth concerns
44.article_body: After logistics company Delhivery said it expects moderate growth of shipment volumes for the rest of FY23 due to high inflation and the average user spending, its stock dropped 14% to â¹479 apiece on BSE on Thursday. Its guidance on flat festive sales and moderate growth in FY23 is expected to have an impact on the broader e-commerce segment's outlook.

45.title: Police officer accidentally shoots mobile shop worker in Punjab, video goes viral
45.article_body: A youth working in a mobile shop in Punjab's Amritsar got injured in an alleged accidental firing by a policeman. "The accused police official has been suspended. We've recovered the CCTV footage," said Varinder Singh, ACP North, Amritsar. He further said that necessary action will be taken as per the statements of the eyewitnesses and the family.

46.title: 6 dacoits barge into house, hold family hostage; loot 40 tola gold, 3 kg silver
46.article_body: Around six dacoits looted 40 tola gold, 3 kg silver and â¹57,000 in cash after they barged into a house with weapons in Rajasthan's Bundi and took the family hostage. The dacoits climbed up on the house's roof and broke the grills before storming into the house. While leaving, they threatened to kill the family if they informed the police.

47.title: Rubber stamp: BJPâs Rajyavardhan Rathore on newly elected Cong chief
47.article_body: After Mallikarjun Kharge won the Congress Presidential poll, BJP leader Rajyavardhan Rathore on Wednesday said after a long period of time, the Congress party is looking away from one family but still it chose a "rubber stamp". "A strong Opposition is required for a strong democracy...Their internal election is just a fraud and drama," he stated.

48.title: Husband held for killing wife, stuffing naked body in a suitcase in Gurugram
48.article_body: Two days after a woman's naked body was found stuffed in a suitcase near Gurugram's IFFCO Chowk, police on Wednesday said her husband had been arrested for allegedly murdering her after a fight. "After killing her, he cut a part of her skin from her right forearm, which had his name tattooed, to avoid being identified," a police officer said.

49.title: Teacher beaten by women with shoes for molesting girls in UP; video surfaces
49.article_body: A government school teacher was beaten up by women with slippers and shoes in UP for allegedly molesting girls. A video of the teacher being assaulted by the girls' parents is going viral on social media. In the video, the school authorities can be seen trying to defuse the situation and guarding the teacher against being subjected to violence.

50.title: He was okay with me: Sreejita De on Sajid Khan's participation in 'BB 16'
50.article_body: Actress Sreejita De, the first contestant who was eliminated from 'Bigg Boss 16', opened up about #MeToo accused Sajid Khan's participation in the show and said he was okay with her and everybody else. "If he would have done something unacceptable, the makers would've thrown him out immediately," Sreejita, who shared a cordial bond with Sajid on the show, said.

51.title: Bank worker, wife cheat ex-Lok Sabha official of over â¹1 cr on pretext of investments
51.article_body: A retired deputy director of security at the Lok Sabha was allegedly cheated of over â¹1 crore by an Axis Bank employee and his wife on the pretext of investments in mutual funds and shares. The 83-year-old retired official knew the accused since 2013 and the latter had been sharing fake documents of investments with him.

52.title: Russian lawmaker calls for ban on WhatsApp for state employees
52.article_body: A Russian lawmaker has called for a ban on the use of WhatsApp for official purposes, seeking promotion of domestically produced software. "Whether it is a Russian alternative or from Dubai...the main thing is...it does not belong to a company that...participates in the information war," Anton Gorelkin said. Russia recently added Meta to its "terrorists and extremists" list, Interfax reported.

53.title: Unity is most significant factor in fight against climate change: PM Modi
53.article_body: PM Narendra Modi at the global launch of 'Mission LiFE' in Gujarat on Thursday said the most significant factor in the fight against climate change is "unity". "A perception was created...climate change is merely a policy-related issue and that either governments or international institutions will take steps regarding it...Now people are feeling the effects of climate change," he said.

54.title: Madagascar minister fired for voting against annexation of Ukrainian regions
54.article_body: Madagascar's President has fired the country's Foreign Minister Richard Randriamandrato for voting at the UN to condemn Russia-backed referendums to annex four Ukrainian regions. Last week, 143 out of 193 members at UNGA voted to condemn Russia's attempts to annex four regions in Ukraine, Madagascar being one of them. Until last week, Madagascar supported neutrality and non-alignment.

55.title: EV financing startup Revfin raises $10 million in Series A round
55.article_body: Electric vehicle financing platform Revfin has secured $10 million in a Series A funding round in a combination of equity and debt. The funding round was led by a climate investments-focused venture capital fund Green Frontier Capital, LC Nueva Investment Partners and existing investors. The company's total funding has reached $25 million. Revfin was founded in 2018 by Sameer Aggarwal.

56.title: Panic among commuters after AC in Virar-bound local stops working
56.article_body: The AC in a Virar-bound local in Mumbai stopped working during peak hours on October 18 due to technical issues causing major inconvenience and panic among commuters. Some passengers experienced suffocation due to the overcrowded train. They got down at Borivali station, demanding the snag be fixed at the earliest. A video of the incident has surfaced on social media.

57.title: Court directs Hyd construction company to pay â¹25,000 to residents
57.article_body: Telangana State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission has directed SLN Constructions to pay â¹25,000 to Mayuri Meadows Resident Owners Welfare Association in Hyderabad. The decision comes after the residents complained that the company deviated from the commitments it made earlier regarding infrastructure work. The company has been given deadline of two months to complete the work.

58.title: 2 held for railway diesel theft, 700 litres diesel recovered in Mumbai
58.article_body: Two persons were arrested on Wednesday for alleged diesel theft from railway premises in Mumbai and 700 litres of diesel was recovered from them. The railways stock diesel for operating water pumps used to flush out water. "Our crime prevention team got the lead regarding this case and a trap was laid accordingly, leading to the...arrest," an RPF official said.

59.title: What is Australia's 'extra fielders' strategy to avoid slow over-rate penalty at T20 WC?
59.article_body: To avoid field restriction penalty if overs aren't bowled in time during their T20 World Cup 2022 matches, Australia will deploy 'extra fielders' strategy. As per Ashton Agar, the players on the bench will be stationed all around the boundary rope to fetch ball and get it into play quickly, especially during powerplay. Agar stated it'll "potentially" save them time.

60.title: At first I could not even walk: Shaheen on recovery after knee injury in July
60.article_body: Pakistan pacer Shaheen Afridi, in a video shared by PCB on Twitter over his knee injury, revealed that he couldn't even walk after picking up the injury in a Test against Sri Lanka in July. "I used to experience pain but took things slowly...[and] regained fitness," he added. Shaheen registered figures of 2/29 in their warm-up match against Afghanistan.

61.title: BMC starts reconstruction of 135-yr-old Malabar Hill water reservoir
61.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has taken up reconstruction work of a 135-year-old water reservoir at Malabar Hill to increase water supply. "The population level and overall demography of south Mumbai has changed drastically...which...has led to a rise in demand in daily water supply," an official said. The capacity of the tank is around 150 Million Litres per Day (MLD).

62.title: Let people breathe: SC rejects urgent hearing of plea on crackers' ban
62.article_body: Supreme Court has rejected a petition seeking an urgent hearing of a plea that challenged the complete ban on the sale and use of all kinds of firecrackers in Delhi. "Let people breathe clean air...spend your money on sweets," the Supreme Court said. Earlier, Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai had said purchasing and bursting firecrackers would be punishable in Delhi.

63.title: Iceland Cricket offers to host Asia Cup, says 'Arctic can offer BCCI what Asia cannot'
63.article_body: After BCCI Secretary Jay Shah stated India won't travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023, Iceland Cricket offered to host the tournament. "Needless to say...our offer last month to host a neutral Test series between Pakistan and India fell on deaf ears...We're happy to bestow the same offer for Asia Cup...Arctic can offer @bcci what Asia cannot," Iceland Cricket tweeted.

64.title: Gang of 4 arrested for looting cash & gold worth â¹1.5 cr from Jâkhand bank
64.article_body: Four members of an inter-state gang involved in looting gold jewellery and cash worth around â¹1.50 crore from a nationalised bank in Jharkhandâs Jamshedpur in August were arrested from Patna, police said. The arrests were made while they were trying to go to Nepal on Tuesday. A special police team was formed to identify and apprehend the criminals.

65.title: Cyberabad Police rescue 3 persons trapped on waterlogged road, share video
65.article_body: The Cyberabad Police on Wednesday rescued three persons who were trapped on a waterlogged road stretch at Shamshabad. According to police, a truck driver and two labourers removed the barricade placed on the service road near Outer Ring Road Exit No 15, where the truck stopped. With the help of ropes, traffic head constable and patrol vehicle constables rescued them.

66.title: Woman carrying gold worth â¹17.5 lakh in her bra padding detained at B'luru airport
66.article_body: Bengaluru Customs officials detained a woman carrying gold worth â¹17.5 lakh in the padding of a bra at Kempegowda International Airport. As per a report, the officers profiling at the arrival bay observed something peculiar about the woman's posture, following which she was approached and questioned. The gold was concealed in form of paste in the bra padding.

67.title: Infosys gives 20-25% salary hikes to top performing employees
67.article_body: Infosys has said that its top performers have received a 20-25% salary hike while a large chunk has received 10-13% increment. It also said that it will try to reduce wage costs amid decreasing attrition levels. The company gave 40,000 promotions in 2021-2022 as compared to 8,000-10,000 annual promotions five years ago.

68.title: RSS misleading country: Karat on Hosabale's 'population imbalance' remark
68.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader Brinda Karat criticised RSS General Secretary Dattatreya Hosabale for his "population imbalance" remark, saying that RSS is misleading the country. Karat further stated that she feels there is a "communal dimension" behind it. Hosabale on Wednesday said religious conversion and migration from Bangladesh are causing "population imbalance".

69.title: Woman suffers burns during dispute with live-in partner in Jharkhand
69.article_body: A 22-year-old woman in Jharkhand's Dumka sustained serious burn injuries during a dispute with her live-in partner, said police. According to police, the woman went to her grandmother's house and refused to return when her partner came for her. The man then threatened to set her on fire using petrol. During the scuffle that ensued, a petrol bottle caught fire.

70.title: 'The Crown' is cruelly unjust towards royals: Judi Dench
70.article_body: Actress Judi Dench said The Crown's new season is "cruelly unjust" towards the royals and "damaging to the institution they represent". "I fear that a significant number of viewers...may take its version of history as being wholly true," she said, adding that the show "seems willing to blur the lines between historical accuracy and crude sensationalism".

71.title: Will reply in democratic manner to Kejriwal's behaviour with MCDs: Amit Shah
71.article_body: Addressing an event in Delhi, Union Home Minister Amit Shah criticised Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and said, "We'll give a reply in a democratic manner to Kejriwal's behaviour with MCDs." "We'll establish daily waste processing facilities in Delhi by 2025 with the help of MCD. In future, such heaps and mountains of garbage won't be seen," he added.

72.title: New wind harvesting device produces 50% more power than solar panels
72.article_body: A new bladeless wind harvesting device, capable of generating 50% more power than solar panels, has been developed by US-based Aeromine Technologies. The device's motionless design harvests energy from airflow above buildings, making them virtually noiseless and safe for birds and other wildlife. The device uses 10% of space that solar panels use and can work 24 hours a day.

73.title: Civic Chandran's anticipatory bail in sexual harassment case cancelled
73.article_body: Kerala High Court has cancelled the anticipatory bail granted to the author and social activist Civic Chandran in connection with the alleged sexual harassment of a Dalit woman, the complaint of which was lodged by her in July. A Kozhikode district sessions court granted anticipatory bail to Chandran in August. He is facing two sexual harassment cases in Kozhikode.

74.title: Stray dog attacks girl in Noida's Golden Palms Society, saved by security guard
74.article_body: A stray dog reportedly tried to attack a girl in Noida's Golden Palms Society. The CCTV footage of the incident that surfaced on social media reportedly shows the dog running behind the girl before trying to attack her. The security guard of the building is then seen coming to her rescue and warning the dog away.

75.title: Man with gold chains worth â¹46 lakh arrested at B'luru airport
75.article_body: Officials of the Bengaluru Customs department arrested a person at Kempegowda International Airport for allegedly smuggling crude gold chains worth â¹46,74,332. The passenger had arrived from Mumbai and was carrying three gold chains weighing 898.91 grams, the department said. In another incident, two people were nabbed for attempting to smuggle gold from Dubai.

76.title: If India go with 6 bowlers, then Pant may not find place in the XI: Gavaskar
76.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said if Hardik Pandya plays as the sixth bowling option in India's T20 World Cup match against Pakistan, then wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant may not find a place in the playing XI. "If Hardik [plays] as the fifth bowler, then Pant [can] bat at number six and Karthik maybe at number seven...[then] four bowlers," added Gavaskar.

77.title: Delhi Police seizes 455 kg of banned firecrackers, 2 arrested
77.article_body: Delhi Police seized 455 kilograms of banned firecrackers and arrested a 27-year-old and a 28-year-old man. "One of the accused told the police that he had bought firecrackers from the Shiv Ram Park area," DCP (Outer North district) Sameer Sharma said. "Acting on the information, a police team raided the area...the other accused was apprehended," Sharma added.

78.title: Old video of man squeezing himself to get inside Mumbai metro resurfaces
78.article_body: An old video of a man squeezing himself to get inside a crowded Mumbai metro train has resurfaced online. In the video, he can be seen trying to adjust himself in the little space available on the train. He was later seen walking out of the coach and then stepping inside again and successfully making his way inside the train.

79.title: Bengaluru woman kills self after getting divorce notice; husband arrested
79.article_body: A software engineer was arrested in Bengaluru a day after his wife died by suicide, after receiving a legal notice for divorce. The victim, an HR manager by profession, left behind a suicide note alleging that her husband tortured her. During the probe, police found some videos on accused's phone in which his wife was seen fighting and abusing him.

80.title: BJP leader tweets video of AAP workers bursting crackers in Delhi amid ban
80.article_body: BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga on Thursday tweeted a video purportedly showing AAP workers bursting firecrackers in Delhi to celebrate Raaj Kumar Anand's appointment as a minister. Bagga pointed out that the AAP-led Delhi government has imposed a ban on crackers ahead of Diwali. Calling CM Arvind Kejriwal "anti-Hindu", he tweeted, "[Kejriwal's] problem is with Diwali, not with firecrackers."

81.title: â¹10,000 fine if ambulance, fire tenders not given way in Tamil Nadu
81.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government has announced a fine of â¹10,000 to be imposed on those who refuse to give way to ambulances and fire tenders while driving a motor vehicle. The government added that blowing horns unnecessarily or in prohibited areas will attract a fine of â¹1,000 for first-time violators and â¹2,000 if the offence is repeated.

82.title: Man challenges B'luru Police to show proof of him not wearing helmet, police shares pic
82.article_body: A man named Felix Raj, who received a challan from Bengaluru Traffic Police for not wearing helmet, shared a photo he received that showed his scooter. "There's no proper evidence...Provide proper image or remove the case," he wrote in a now-deleted tweet. Bengaluru Traffic Police responded by sharing a photo that showed him sitting on his scooter without a helmet.

83.title: Patient died after receiving mosambi juice instead of plasma: UP family
83.article_body: A family in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj has claimed that a dengue patient died after being given sweet lime (mosambi) juice rather than blood plasma at a hospital. According to authorities, a team has been formed to investigate the case concerning fake plasma supply to dengue patients. UP's Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak promised strict action will be taken against the culprits.

84.title: Not a river but my building's basement: Twitter user on video of flooding after B'luru rain
84.article_body: A Twitter user shared a video of flooding caused by rain in Bengaluru and wrote, "This isn't a river, it's my building's basement." The rain that started on Wednesday caused waterlogging in several areas of the city. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a yellow alert for Bengaluru and said the city will continue to receive rain till October 23.

85.title: Professor sends porn videos to student on Instagram in B'luru; booked
85.article_body: A professor from a reputed college in Bengaluru has been booked for allegedly sending porn videos to a student on Instagram. Police have questioned the accused, identified as Madhusudhan Acharya. He has confessed to the crime. The South East Cyber Economic and Narcotics (CEN) police are investigating the case presently.

86.title: Minister apologises to Pune citizens for inconvenience caused amid rains
86.article_body: Maharashtra minister and BJP leader Chandrakant Patil has apologised to the residents of Pune for the inconvenience caused by unprecedented rains. "I will study what led to multiple problems after rain," the minister said. Reportedly, two people died and 500 were evacuated after heavy rain lashed parts of the city on Monday and Tuesday and caused waterlogging in several areas.

87.title: Russia warns UN against investigating use of Iranian drones in Ukraine
87.article_body: Russia has warned the UN against investigating the use of Iran-made drones to carry out attacks in Ukraine, saying the move would be "absolutely unprofessional and political". Ukraine had invited UN officials to examine the debris from Shahed-136 drones. Ukraine accused Iran of breaking a UN Security Council embargo on the transfer of drones with a 300 km range.

88.title: Engineers in the US unveil the world's largest digital camera; share pic
88.article_body: Engineers at the SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory have unveiled the world's largest digital camera. "Although the camera isn't fully complete yet, all of its mechanical components are now together for the first timeâin one photogenic structure," the engineers said. The 3,200-megapixel camera is being made to be put up in an observatory in the Chilean Andes.

89.title: Sonia Gandhi has last word in Cong, likely to remain so: Ashwani Kumar
89.article_body: After Mallikarjun Kharge won Congress Presidential poll, former Union Minister Ashwani Kumar said this shows Sonia Gandhi has the last word in the organisation's internal politics. Furthermore, Kumar said that Sonia Gandhi is likely to command such respect as long as she is active in the party in whatever capacity.

90.title: My journey would've been incomplete without working with Big B: Parineeti
90.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra has said that her journey in the film industry would have been incomplete if she didn't get to work with Amitabh Bachchan. The actress will be seen sharing screen space with Bachchan in Sooraj Barjatya's 'Uunchai'. "The dedication, the drive and the passion he has for cinema is incomparable and that's what sets him apart," she said.

91.title: Credit to all the boys for coming back strong: Dasun as SL reach Super 12
91.article_body: Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka has credited his players for coming back strongly to reach the Super 12 stage of the ongoing T20 World Cup after their defeat against Namibia in their first group stage match. "The boys have done well though, especially the bowling group," added Dasun. Sri Lanka defeated UAE and Netherlands to secure their qualification.

92.title: BJP releases final list of 6 candidates for Himachal Pradesh polls
92.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has released the final list of six candidates for the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls. The party has fielded Ramesh Dhawala from Dehra, Ravinder Singh Ravi from Jawalamukhi, Maheshwar Singh from Kullu, Maya Sharma from Barsar, Ramkumar from Baroli and Kaul Negi from Rampur. BJP had released the first list of 62 candidates on Wednesday.

93.title: Asian Paints' Q2 net profit rises by 32% to â¹803 cr, revenue up 19%
93.article_body: Asian Paints, on Thursday, posted a 32% year-on-year growth in consolidated net profit at â¹803 crore for the quarter ended September led by price hikes. Its net profit was â¹605 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. Its consolidated revenue saw a 19% increase at â¹8,457 crore. The company also declared an interim dividend of â¹4.40 per equity share.

94.title: Pune doctors remove 9-kg ovarian tumour from 66-yr-old woman's abdomen
94.article_body: Doctors at Pune's Sanjeevan Hospital removed an ovarian tumour weighing nearly nine kilograms from a 66-year-old woman's abdomen. The woman's abdominal size had started increasing gradually over the last 10 years. She underwent investigations in June after feeling a tightness in her abdomen as she was unable to bend for household chores. "The ovarian mass...was removed intact," a doctor said.

95.title: Gurugram Police returns 240 lost mobile phones to owners
95.article_body: The Gurugram Police on Wednesday returned 240 lost mobile phones worth around â¹40 lakh to their respective owners. Some of these devices were reportedly lost more than one and a half years ago. "These phones either fell from the pockets of their respective owners or got misplaced. Complaints were filed with the police to trace them," the police added.

96.title: School principal arrested for failing to report Hyderabad rape case
96.article_body: The principal of a school in Hyderabad was arrested and remanded in judicial custody on Wednesday evening for failing to report a rape case. This comes after the principal's 36-year-old driver was arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a four-year-old girl student inside the premises. The accused driver had been abusing the child for two months, police said.

97.title: BJP spent over â¹223 crore in 2022 Assembly polls in 5 states: ADR
97.article_body: The BJP spent â¹223.148 crore in the run-up to Assembly elections in Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Manipur, Goa and Punjab in 2022, a report by Association of Democratic Reforms (ADR) revealed. The BJP was the top spender among all political parties in these elections, the report added. With an expenditure of â¹102.65 crore, the Congress was ranked as the second-largest spender.

98.title: Delhi govt withdraws â¹500 fine for not wearing masks in public places
98.article_body: Delhi government on Thursday issued an order withdrawing the â¹500 fine for not wearing masks in public places in the wake of declining COVID-19 cases. "However, in crowded public places, all public are advised to wear mask," the government's order read. Delhi Disaster Management Authority on September 22 had decided to withdraw the fine but hadn't issued an official notification.

99.title: Vicky is the perfect counterbalance for the person I am: Katrina
99.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif said her husband and actor Vicky Kaushal is "the perfect counterbalance" for the "hyper, panicking and overthinking" person she is. "After marriage, there's a lot of calmness and stability in my life with having Vicky around all the time," she added. On the work front, Katrina is currently busy with the promotions of her film 'Phone Bhoot'.

100.title: Nothing to do with party: BJP leader after attending Ram Rahim's satsang
100.article_body: Karnal's senior Deputy Mayor Rajesh Aggi, one among the BJP leaders who attended online satsang of rape and murder convict Gurmeet Ram Rahim, said that it has nothing to do with BJP and upcoming bypoll election. "I was invited to the satsang by the 'sadh sangat'. Many people in my ward are associated with Baba," Aggi added.

101.title: Iran sanctions UK individuals, institutions for 'inciting violence'
101.article_body: Iran on Wednesday imposed sanctions on several British people and institutions for their "deliberate actions in support of terrorism, incitement of violence, and human rights violation". The sanctions include a ban on issuing visas and seizure of designated individuals' assets in Iran. Last week, UK sanctioned Iran's morality police and other senior security officials over Mahsa Amini's death.

102.title: Adani Group to invest â¹10,000 crore in Ahmedabad airport: Report
102.article_body: The Adani Group is planning to invest â¹10,000 crore in the Ahmedabad airport between 2023 and 2027 to expand the passenger handling capacity by nearly three times, according to a report. In a presentation to potential investors, Adani Group said it would make the Ahmedabad airport a regional hub connecting airports such as Bhuj, Kandla, Jamnagar and Bhavnagar.

103.title: Pakistan should not play against India on October 23: Kamran Akmal
103.article_body: Reacting to BCCI Secretary Jay Shah's remarks that India won't travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023, Pakistani wicketkeeper Kamran Akmal said Pakistan shouldn't play against India on October 23. He added that if Asia Cup 2023 is not held in Pakistan, then Pakistan and India should not play each other at any level. He further called Shah's statement "unexpected".

104.title: I can give it to you in writing that India won't go to Pakistan: Aakash
104.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said he can "give in writing" that India won't travel to Pakistan, and the 2023 Asia Cup will be held at a neutral venue. "Pakistan will also...come to play in the World Cup (in India)," he added. Notably, Pakistan have threatened to boycott the ODI World Cup if India don't travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup.

105.title: 5G service will take education system to next level: PM Narendra Modi
105.article_body: The recently launched 5G telecom service will take the education system to next level in the country, PM Narendra Modi said on Wednesday. "Some people say we've seen 2G, 3G, 4G and now 5G...so, what's the big difference?...I will say if 4G is a bicycle, then 5G is an airplane," PM Modi said at an event in Gujarat.

106.title: BMC to raze 2 bridges in Mumbai's Kandivali, new ones to cost â¹43 cr
106.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will demolish and reconstruct two bridges in Mumbai's Kandivali (West) area. The two bridges - Irani Wadi bridge and Walani bridge are over the Poisar river. The civic body has issued a tender worth around â¹43 crore for the project which will take 24 months time for its completion, excluding the monsoon season.

107.title: Hyundai probes child labour in US supply chain, may cut ties with suppliers
107.article_body: South Korea's Hyundai Motor Company is probing child labour violations in its US supply chain and plans to "sever ties" with its suppliers in Alabama found to have employed underage workers, Hyundai's Global COO JosÃ© MuÃ±oz said. Reuters had documented in July that a Hyundai-controlled metal stamping plant in rural Alabama, called SMART Alabama, LLC, employed children, including a 12-year-old.

108.title: Canara Bank's net profit rises 89.5% to â¹2,525 cr in Sept quarter
108.article_body: Canara Bank reported an 89.5% jump in net profit to â¹2,525 crore in the September quarter driven by strong loan growth and improvement in asset quality. The lender's net interest income rose by 18.5% to â¹7,434 crore and net interest margin hit a nine-quarter high of 2.83%. Its gross non-performing assets fell to 6.37% from 6.98% in the previous quarter.

109.title: UP govt cancels doctors' leaves amid dengue surge
109.article_body: Amid rising cases of dengue in Uttar Pradesh, leaves of all doctors and paramedical staff in government hospitals have been cancelled. "Beds are reserved in hospitals and preparations for enough platelets are being made," said Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak. He said dengue cases are less compared to last year and all measures are being taken to avoid the spread.

110.title: Israel will not supply weapons to Ukraine: Defence Minister Gantz
110.article_body: Israeli Defence Minister Benny Gantz said Israel's policy in relation to Ukraine will not change. "We'll continue to support...the West [but] will not provide weapons...[to Ukraine]," he added. This comes days after deputy head of Russia's Security Council, Dmitry Medvedev, warned Israel against arms deliveries to Ukraine, saying, it would "destroy all bilateral relations" between both countries.

111.title: Tesla cars not ready to be approved as fully self-driving this year: Musk
111.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said the company's 'Full Self-Driving' (FSD) software won't get regulatory approval this year. He said cars with FSD aren't ready to have no one behind the wheel but drivers will rarely have to touch controls. "The car will be able to take you from your home to your work...without you touching the wheel," Musk said.

112.title: Satya Nadella gets Padma Bhushan in US, plans to visit India in Jan
112.article_body: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, who has been awarded the Padma Bhushan, said it's an honour for him to receive India's third-highest civilian award and he looks forward to continuing to work with people across India. Nadella also plans to visit India next January. He received the award from India's Consul General in San Francisco, Dr TV Nagendra Prasad, last week.

113.title: JP Nadda's 'grave' dug up in Telangana, BJP calls it despicable
113.article_body: A symbolic grave of BJP chief JP Nadda was found dug up in poll-bound Munugode's Choutuppal area in Telangana. A picture of Nadda was placed with a placard over it which read - Regional Fluoride Mitigation & Research Center, Choutuppal. Blaming TRS workers for the act, BJP leader Vishnu Vardhan Reddy tweeted, "This is despicable!"

114.title: 23-year-old Instagram influencer shot dead at her home in Brazil
114.article_body: A popular Brazilian Instagram influencer was shot dead at her home by two assailants, who later escaped on a motorbike. Twenty-three-year-old NÃºbia Cristina Braga was found dead at her home in the neighbourhood of Santa Maria in Aracaju, Sergipe state, Brazil, on the night of October 14. She had visited a hair salon just before she was killed.

115.title: India not in a position to listen to anyone: Sports Minister after Pak threatens to boycott WC
115.article_body: After Pakistan threatened to boycott World Cup 2023 if India don't travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup, Sports Minister Anurag Thakur said, "The World Cup will be organised next year, and it will be a grand and historic event. India is not in a position to listen to anyone." "There are security concerns in Pakistan," he further said.

116.title: Indonesia temporarily bans sale of all syrup medicines after 99 child deaths
116.article_body: Indonesia has temporarily banned the sale of all syrup-based medications after the deaths of 99 children. Indonesia said some syrup medicines were found to contain ingredients linked to acute kidney injuries (AKI) that claimed 99 lives. The ban comes after WHO issued a global alert over four Indian-made cough syrups linked to the deaths of 66 children in The Gambia.

117.title: Farmers in New Zealand protest plan to tax cow burps
117.article_body: Farmers across New Zealand took to the streets on their tractors on Thursday to protest against the government's plan to tax agricultural emissions. Last week, New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern unveiled plans for the world's first levy on agricultural gases and biogenic methane, which mainly come from burps produced by the country's estimated six million cows and 26 million sheep.

118.title: Congress Presidential poll rigged with precision: BJP's Amit Malviya
118.article_body: A day after Congress Presidential poll results were declared, BJP leader Amit Malviya on Thursday said election was "rigged with such precision that Mallikarjun Kharge got 88% of the votes". "Just short of 90% mark, which could've given [Shashi] Tharoor option to trigger formal complaint alleging malpractice," Malviya tweeted. "He was denied that manoeuvre too. What a farce!" he added.

119.title: Hyd man kills wife over argument on attending a marriage, stages suicide
119.article_body: A Hyderabad-based auto driver allegedly killed his 18-year-old wife after arguing over attending a wedding and later tried hanging her body using a scarf. The accused performed the act with help of his sister. The accused later shifted the victim to hospital and misled the doctors that she died by suicide. On sensing foul play, the doctors informed the police.

120.title: No way: Rishab Shetty on claims that he's leaving Kannada industry
120.article_body: Actor-director Rishab Shetty has rubbished a fan's claim that he is leaving the Kannada film industry after the success of his latest film 'Kantara'. "No chance, no way," he wrote in response to the fan's tweet, which came after Telugu producer Allu Aravind announced that he is teaming up with Rishab for a film.

121.title: Playing vs Pak is special, I remember smacking Hassan Ali for sixes last time: Pant
121.article_body: Ahead of their game against Pakistan in the 2022 T20 World Cup on Sunday, India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant has said playing against Pakistan is "special" as many emotions are involved, and there's a "special hype" around the match. Recalling the India-Pakistan match at the 2021 WC, Pant said, "I remember [smacking] Hassan Ali for two sixes in the same over."

122.title: Belarus unable to pay off foreign debt due to sanctions from US & EU
122.article_body: Belarus has said that it is unable to repay its foreign debt due to sanctions imposed by US and EU over its alliance with Russia. On Monday, the World Bank said it had placed all loans made by its main lending unit to Belarus into "nonperforming" status effective immediately. This came as Belarus had overdue payments amounting to $68.43 million.

123.title: Tamil Nadu Assembly unanimously passes bill to ban hookah bars in state
123.article_body: Tamil Nadu Health Minister M Subramanian introduced a bill in the Assembly to ban hookah bars in the state and it was passed unanimously. Violators will attract imprisonment of up to three years and a fine of up to â¹50,000. The bill gives power to police officers of the sub-inspector rank and above to seize any material from hookah bars.

124.title: 'Tripling' gave me currency of fame: Actor Amol Parashar
124.article_body: Actor Amol Parashar said that his web show 'Tripling' helped him gain recognition and gave him "the currency of fame". "I think I'm still acting in the same way, it's just that I am recognised for my work," he said. Amol shared that he was offered similar roles after 'Tripling' but nothing could match his character Chitwan's funniness and humour.

125.title: Australian rugby player found dead at Spanish nightclub after going missing
125.article_body: Australian rugby player Liam Hampson was found dead in Spain after going missing on a night out with friends. Local media reports said that the 24-year-old's body was found on the floor of a Barcelona nightclub after an apparent fall. He had been travelling in Europe with a group including National Rugby League (NRL) players.

126.title: Good on you: Sona to Ali as he demands Sajid's exit from 'Bigg Boss 16'
126.article_body: Singer Sona Mohapatra tweeted in favour of Ali Fazal after the actor demanded the eviction of #MeToo accused Sajid Khan from 'Bigg Boss 16'. "Good on you," she wrote, adding that she wished there were more people from the film fraternity "who also had a voice to speak up" like him. "'Pretty' faces on 'Posters' are so 'Passe'," she added.

127.title: Tesla can become more valuable than Apple & Saudi Aramco combined: Musk
127.article_body: During a conference call for Tesla's quarterly report, CEO Elon Musk remarked that he saw a path for Tesla to become more valuable than Apple and Saudi Aramco, combined. Currently, Tesla's market valuation is under $700 billion, while Apple is worth $2.3 trillion and oil producer Saudi Aramco is worth $2.1 trillion.

128.title: Maharashtra ATS arrests 4 alleged PFI activists from Raigad
128.article_body: Maharashtra Anti Terrorism Squad (ATS) has arrested four alleged members of the banned Popular Front of India (PFI) from Raigad's Panvel. Those arrested include a local member of the PFI's state expansion committee, a local unit secretary and two other workers, an official said. Over 250 members were detained or arrested recently in raids against PFI across multiple states.

129.title: UK prison nurse jailed for exchanging 'flirtatious' calls with inmate
129.article_body: A 25-year-old UK prison nurse has been jailed after exchanging "flirtatious" texts and calls with a male inmate. Elyse Hibbs met the inmate when she gave him medical treatment. The prisoner then used his mother and a friend to track down Hibbs on Instagram. Hibbs gave them her mobile number, following which she and the inmate started exchanging phone calls.

130.title: Sri Lanka defeat Netherlands, qualify for Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022
130.article_body: Sri Lanka defeated Netherlands by 16 runs in their last T20 World Cup 2022 first round match in Geelong. With this, Sri Lanka have qualified for the Super 12 stage of the tournament. Sri Lanka are on top of the Group A table with four points. Netherlands will qualify for the next stage if UAE defeat Namibia today.

131.title: We condemn VIP culture: Doctors on AIIMS SOPs for treatment of MPs
131.article_body: Doctors' bodies opposed new standard operating procedures of AIIMS for the treatment of parliamentarians. "We condemn VIP culture. No patient should suffer at the cost of another's privileges," said Federation of Resident Doctors' Association. "Every patient in this country deserves good treatment. That includes an MP and also a homeless person," said Federation of All India Medical Association.

132.title: Lupin to buy 2 inhalation brands from Sunovion for $75 million
132.article_body: Lupin will acquire two inhalation medicines, Brovana Inhalation Solution and Xopenex Inhalation Aerosol, from Sunovion Pharmaceuticals Inc. The transaction will take place for a cash consideration of $75 million. Brovana is used in the treatment of chronic bronchitis and Xopenex is used in the prevention of bronchospasm in adults, adolescents and children aged four and above.

133.title: Gandhi family's supremacy to continue: Ashwani Kumar on Cong chief poll results
133.article_body: After Congress Presidential poll results were declared on Wednesday, ex-Union Minister Ashwani Kumar said the supremacy of the Gandhi family will continue despite Mallikarjun Kharge becoming the party chief. "As long as the Gandhi family is there, they will be dominant," Kumar added. He stated that Kharge would not be able to succeed in the party without Sonia Gandhiâs support.

134.title: Over â¹27 lakh fine imposed on construction sites in Noida for violating norms
134.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board along with Noida authority started joint inspections to ensure that all dust control measures are being followed, especially at construction sites. Around â¹9.5 lakh fine was imposed on Monday at different sites while another â¹17.6 lakh fine was imposed on Tuesday. Penalty of â¹5 lakh was imposed on private contractor who constructed Signature Bridge.

135.title: Pak will have difficulties facing Shami, Bhuvi in Aus conditions: Aaqib Javed
135.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed has said that the absence of Jasprit Bumrah from India's squad won't make much of a difference in Australian conditions. "Bumrah ends up making a difference even on flat pitches...Mohammad Shami, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Mohammed Siraj are good seam bowlers. So, Pakistan will have difficulties," explained Aaqib. "Runs won't come easy (for Pakistan)," he added.

136.title: Bengaluru witnessed at least one child marriage every month since 2020: Data
136.article_body: More than one child marriage is illegally solemnised every month in Bengaluru urban and rural combined, data from the Department of Women and Child Development showed. A total of 47 marriages occurred in Bengaluru between 2020 and August 2022, according to the data. In 2022 alone, till August, 51 complaints of child marriages were reported in the city.

137.title: Builder Paras Porwal jumps to death from 23rd floor in Mumbai
137.article_body: Well-known Mumbai builder Paras Porwal jumped to death from the 23rd floor of the Shantikamal Cooperative Housing Society building near Chinchpokli station on Thursday morning. According to the police, the 57-year-old jumped from the balcony of his gym. A police official told The Indian Express that Porwal allegedly died by suicide because of personal issues.

138.title: Ukrainians told to 'charge everything' after Russia attacks power plants
138.article_body: Ukraine's national energy company, Ukrenergo, urged citizens to "charge everything" by Thursday morning amid expected electricity cuts as power plants were hit by Russian missiles. "From October 10, Ukrainian energy system has suffered an attack from the enemy greater than in 8 months of war," it added. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said 30% of power stations were destroyed in strikes.

139.title: Russia to evacuate 10,000 people a day from occupied Kherson region
139.article_body: Russian-installed authorities in the occupied Ukrainian region of Kherson have planned to evacuate 10,000 people a day over the next six days as Ukraine prepares for counter-offensive in the area. Kherson residents received warnings via texts on the urgent need to evacuate, Russian media reported. Russian forces in Kherson have been driven back 20-30 km in the last few weeks.

140.title: Tracxn Technologies' shares surge nearly 6% on market debut
140.article_body: Tracxn Technologies' stock, which made its secondary market debut on Thursday, opened on BSE at â¹84.5 apiece, which is a premium of â¹4.5 or 5.6% over the upper end of its IPO price range. On NSE, its shares opened at â¹83 apiece, a premium of â¹Rs 3 or 3.8%. At 11:30 am, its stock was trading 18.44% higher on NSE.

141.title: Police arrest 4 in possession of MD in separate cases, 2 FIRs lodged
141.article_body: Pune City Police arrested four persons in possession of the banned drug mephedrone (MD) in two separate cases and lodged two FIRs. In the first case, police recovered 6.970 grams of MD worth over â¹1.09 lakh from the possession of an accused. In the second case, police recovered 7.690 grams of MD worth over â¹1.15 lakh.

142.title: BJP leaders attend rape convict Ram Rahim's online satsang in Karnal
142.article_body: BJP leaders, including Karnal Mayor Renu Bala Gupta, attended an online satsang conducted by Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim, a rape and murder convict who is out on parole. In a video, Gupta can be seen seeking blessings from Rahim and calling him 'pitaji' (father). Gupta said her participation should not be seen as a political move.

143.title: Extremely challenging: Kajal Aggarwal on balancing work & motherhood
143.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal on Wednesday penned a note speaking about how balancing work and motherhood has been "extremely challenging". The actress shared that being a mother has been the most "rewarding job". She added, "I've gone from a scared young woman holding a wriggling mass on her chest...to now fulfilling mommy duties and learning as I go along."

144.title: Don't date an actor: Janhvi's dating advice to sister Khushi Kapoor
144.article_body: Speaking about the dating advice she'd give to her sister Khushi Kapoor, actress Janhvi Kapoor said she'd tell her to not date an actor. Citing the reason behind it, Janhvi said, "Just because I think the kind of girls I and her are, I just think it would be better." Janhvi added that she'd want Khushi to know her worth.

145.title: Kohli can teach you how to go through pressure situations: Pant
145.article_body: India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant has said it's good to have a batting partner like Virat Kohli in high-pressure matches like the upcoming game against Pakistan in the 2022 T20 World Cup. "Kohli can actually teach you how to go through situations...and how to maintain that run-a-ball pressure," said Pant. The India-Pakistan match will be played on October 23.

146.title: Video showing Indian Americans blocking US road for wedding procession goes viral
146.article_body: A video showing several Indian Americans dancing to Indian songs as part of a wedding procession in New York has gone viral. "We shut down broadway for my brother's wedding!" read the text insert in the video shared by Suraj Patel. Reacting to the video, a social media user wrote, "Isn't this a grave inconvenience to residents?"

147.title: Have a guess, says King Charles after school kid asks his age; video surfaces
147.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media wherein King Charles III can be seen interacting with children from the Barn Croft Primary School in East London. In the video, a child asked the King, "How old are you, King Charles?" To which he responded, "Have a guess", following which the students and teachers could be heard laughing.

148.title: Intellemo raises â¹3 cr in Inflection Point Ventures-led seed round
148.article_body: Digital marketing startup Intellemo has secured over â¹3 crore in a seed funding round led by Inflection Point Ventures. The funding round also saw participation from Cred Founder Kunal Shah, Fitso Co-founders Rahool Sureka and Saurabh Aggarwal, and Badri Ecofibres Co-founder Amit Gupta. The company was co-founded in 2018 by Saurabh Gupta, Tusha Agrawal and Shivam Gupta.

149.title: India reports 2,141 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 25,510
149.article_body: India reported 2,141 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 1,946 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 25,510. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,943 following 20 casualties in the last 24 hours.

150.title: Over 10 stray dogs caught from Noida Sector 100 after infant's death
150.article_body: Dogcatchers caught over 10 stray dogs from Noida Sector 100 after receiving complaints from residents about the presence of more "aggressive" community dogs in the area. The Noida authority had dispatched dogcatchers to relocate and rehabilitate the canines. The step comes after an infant was mauled to death by a stray dog in Noida's Lotus Boulevard society.

151.title: Airtel 5G Plus is now live in 8 cities: Airtel
151.article_body: Airtel has launched Airtel 5G Plus in 8 cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai and more in a phased manner. The network offers 30X higher speed and works on 5G-enabled devices and handsets with existing Airtel SIMs, it revealed. Airtel 5G Plus also runs on the most widely accepted technology in the world with the most developed ecosystem.

152.title: Didnât pitch myself as candidate of dissent but change: Congâs Tharoor
152.article_body: After Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday conceded defeat in Congress Presidential election, he said, "I didn't pitch myself as a candidate of dissent but change...change in the manner in which we will do our regular work." Furthermore, he added, "I would stress it is not so much about dissent but how to make a good party better."

153.title: Tesla posts $21.45 billion revenue in Q3, net income at $3.3 billion
153.article_body: Tesla's revenue for the third quarter was $21.45 billion, short of analysts' estimates of $21.96 billion. Its net income was $3.3 billion, nearly doubled the $1.62 billion it earned in the same period last year. The company said it had a negative foreign exchange impact of $250 million on its earnings as the US dollar strengthened against major currencies.

154.title: Cyberabad She Teams received 1,571 harassment cases until Sept this year
154.article_body: The Cyberabad She Teams received as many as 1,571 harassment cases, the highest in the state, according to the data released by the Women Safety Wing of Telangana Police on Wednesday. The data states the number of cases till September end this year. Additional Director General of Police, Swati Lakra, said that 331 She Teams are working across Telangana currently.

155.title: Droom Technology, Aprameya Engineering withdraw IPO plans
155.article_body: Automobile e-commerce platform Droom Technology and medical equipment maker Aprameya Engineering have withdrawn their initial public offering (IPO) plans, according to a notification on the SEBI's website. In November 2021, Droom had sought SEBI's approval for an IPO. Aprameya Engineering had filed for an IPO in September 2022 planning to issue 50 lakh shares via fresh issue.

156.title: Canada to host meeting of female foreign ministers to discuss Iran protests
156.article_body: Canada to host a virtual meeting of female foreign ministers on Thursday to discuss Iran's "brutal" crackdown on protests ignited by 22-year-old Mahsa Amini's death after being detained by the morality police. "My counterparts and I'll gather to send a clear message: the Iranian regime must end all forms of violence and persecution against...Iranians," Canadian Foreign Minister Melanie Joly said.

157.title: I wanted people to remember: Shaheen on 2021 WC game vs India
157.article_body: Talking about the 2021 T20 WC match against India in which he dismissed Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul and Virat Kohli, Pakistan's Shaheen Afridi said he wanted people to remember his performance for ages. "I had observed Rohit struggle against inswingers...I thought why not use it," he recalled. "Shoaib Malik asked me...to go for a length ball [against Rahul]," revealed Shaheen.

158.title: 3 children buried to death under earthen boulders in UP's Etah
158.article_body: At least three children died after they got buried under huge earthen boulders in the Nayagaon Police Station area in Uttar Pradesh's Etah on Wednesday, police said. The deceased, all 12 years old, were reportedly on their way home from school when the incident happened. Searches were conducted by the locals after the children didn't return home from school.

159.title: No hotel, no staff: Ricky Kej on being stranded in Istanbul due to flight diversion
159.article_body: Grammy-winning Indian-origin composer Ricky Kej took to Twitter after his Lufthansa Frankfurt-Bengaluru flight was diverted to Istanbul due to a medical emergency on October 18. Sharing a series of tweets, Kej wrote, "Over 31 hours now...Thanks to the utter disregard of Indian passengers by Lufthansa. Still no...statement, or any information from them...Two nights now without a bed".

160.title: Ronaldo storms down tunnel after not being brought on to play against Spurs, pics surface
160.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo was seen storming down the Old Trafford tunnel in the 90th minute after not being brought on by manager Erik ten Hag to play against Tottenham Hotspur (Spurs) in Premier League on Wednesday night. "I will deal with that tomorrow not today," Erik ten Hag said on Wednesday about the situation. United defeated Spurs 2-0.

161.title: China blocks proposal to designate son of Hafiz Saeed as UN-listed terrorist
161.article_body: A day after blocking the proposal to designate Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist Shahid Mahmood as a global terrorist, China blocked a proposal by India and US at the UN to blacklist Hafiz Talah Saeed, son of Lashkar-e-Taiba chief Hafiz Saeed. This is the fifth time in four months that China has blocked proposals to designate Pakistan-based terrorists at the UN.

162.title: There was a time when I was arrogant: Varun on 10 years in B'wood
162.article_body: Varun Dhawan, who completed 10 years in Bollywood on Wednesday, opened up about the time when he was arrogant and didn't care about what people were saying. "There was a time when I'd think arrogantly, that everything is going fine, so why should I even care what someone is saying," he said at the trailer launch of his film 'Bhediya'.

163.title: GIC Affiliates to invest â¹1,045 cr in IRB Infra's Ganga e-way project
163.article_body: IRB Infrastructure Developers on Wednesday said Singapore-based GIC Affiliates will invest â¹1,045 crore in the Ganga Expressway project. IRB Infra has completed the equity raise of â¹533.20 crore for the project. GIC contributed â¹261.29 crore and IRB Infra, which will hold a 51% stake, contributed â¹271.90 crore. Both companies will invest a total of â¹2,133 crore in the project.

164.title: MPSC aspirants hold protest over non-payment of stipends in Pune
164.article_body: Students preparing for Maharashtra Public Service Commission (MPSC) held a protest against the state government at Pune's Shastri Road over non-payment of stipends they were promised under 'MahaJyoti' scheme. "We were selected to get the emergency funds and monthly stipends from the state government, but we have not yet received any amount,'' said an MPSC aspirant.

165.title: 5 Russians charged with procuring US military tech ahead of Ukraine war
165.article_body: US federal prosecutors have charged five Russians and two Venezuelans for their alleged roles in procuring American military technology ahead of Ukraine war. Some defendants have been accused of using a German firm to transport semiconductors and satellites that could be used in missile systems and fighter aircraft. Some equipment recovered on battlefields in Ukraine, US Justice Department said.

166.title: Tahir Hussain discharged of arson charge in a Delhi riots case
166.article_body: A Delhi Court discharged former AAP councillor Tahir Hussain and nine others in a case of arson in connection with the 2020 Delhi riots. "It's well apparent...IPC Section 436 (arson) was added without due application of mind," the court said. It remanded the matter back to the chief metropolitan magistrate for trial in other sections against the accused.

167.title: My best director: Salman as he shares Sooraj Barjatya's 'Uunchai' trailer
167.article_body: Bollywood actor Salman Khan called Sooraj Barjatya his "best director" and "one of the best human beings" he has met and worked with. On Wednesday, Salman shared the trailer of 'Uunchai' on Twitter and wished the director "all the best" for his upcoming directorial, which stars Amitabh Bachchan, Anupam Kher and others. The film will release on November 11.

168.title: We're not thinking about semis or final, will focus on each match: Rohit
168.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has said it's too early to think about the knockout stage of the 2022 T20 World Cup. "We need to do a lot of things right to get there...[We'll] focus on each team we're going to come against," said Rohit in a video posted by BCCI. "Been a while since we won World Cup," he added.

169.title: Mumbai Police warns against sale of firecrackers without licence
169.article_body: The Mumbai Police issued a notice regarding the sale of firecrackers ahead of Diwali and said that those selling firecrackers without a licence will face consequences. "No person at any public place in the limits of Brihanmumbai shall sell, possess, offer, display, carry or expose for purpose of sale of any firecrackers or fireworks without a licence," the notice read.

170.title: Wall collapses near Bengaluru's Majestic bus station after heavy rain
170.article_body: As heavy rain lashed parts of Bengaluru on Wednesday, a wall collapsed near Majestic bus station damaging several cars parked near the wall. Several areas like Bellandur, Shivajinagara and parts of the IT corridor saw waterlogging after the heavy rainfall. Bengaluru has recorded the highest annual record of rainfall this year, with 1,700 mm of rainfall till October 18.

171.title: Conversion and migration causing population imbalance: RSSâ Hosabale
171.article_body: RSS General Secretary Dattatreya Hosabale on Wednesday said that religious conversion and migration from Bangladesh are causing "population imbalance" and called for strict implementation of anti-conversion laws. He stated that RSS is trying to create awareness on conversions. He said as a result, there has been a favourable outcome of âghar wapsiâ.Â

172.title: 2 Mumbai men arrested for running drug operation on social media
172.article_body: Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB), Mumbai has arrested two persons, both residents of Ghatkopar, for allegedly running a drug trafficking operation using social media platforms. According to NCB, the accused created a group named 'Party Pack' on Instagram for their operation. The suppliers and consumers of the syndicate are said to be spread across Maharashtra, Goa, Delhi, Gujarat and Andhra Pradesh.

173.title: Man charged for threatening to kill US President Biden, Capitol riots investigator
