173.article_body: A US grand jury has indicted jailed 25-year-old Robert Vargo for threatening to kill US President Joe Biden, the chair of congressional committee investigating the US Capitol riots, Bennie Thompson and his family, prosecutors said. "You and Joe Biden soon will face death for the wrongs you've done to US," Vargo said in a letter he sent to Thompson's office.

174.title: Xi would be a sinner of all Chinese people if he attacks island: Taiwan
174.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping would become a "sinner" of all Chinese people if he attacked Taiwan, Chen Ming-tong, head of Taiwan's National Security Bureau, said. He also said that the Chinese President would face international sanctions and diplomatic isolation if he followed through on his threats of ever attacking Taiwan. China claims democratically governed Taiwan as its own territory.

175.title: Dogecoin creator asks if Musk is naming new COVID-19 variants, Tesla CEO replies
175.article_body:
Dogecoin creator Shibetoshi Nakamoto shared a screenshot of a news article mentioning the names of different COVID-19 variants. Sharing the screengrab, he wrote, "Did Elon Musk name these new covid variants." To which Musk replied saying, "Definitely giving me kid naming ideas."
In May 2020, Musk announced that he and singer Grimes have named their baby boy X Ã A-12.

176.title: Putin sent me 20 vodka bottles, I responded with 20 wine bottles: Ex-Italy PM Berlusconi
176.article_body: In a recording released by the LaPresse news agency, former Italy PM Silvio Berlusconi was heard saying, "I have reconnected with President Putin â a little, a lot." "He sent me 20 bottles of vodka and a really sweet letter for my birthday. I responded with 20 bottles of wine and a similarly sweet letter," Berlusconi said.

177.title: Builder, contractor booked after labourer falls to death in Pune
177.article_body: A builder and a contractor have been booked after a 30-year-old labourer fell from the third floor of a building undergoing construction and died in Pune's Kondhwa. The two have been accused of not following labour safety norms like providing helmets, safety nets and safety belts to labourers. "No arrest has been made in the case," said police.

178.title: Harbhajan Singh names his India playing XI for T20 World Cup match against Pakistan
178.article_body: Ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh named his India playing XI for the T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan, which is scheduled to take place on October 23. He named Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul, Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav as the first four batters, followed by Hardik Pandya, Dinesh Karthik, Axar Patel, Yuzvendra Chahal, Arshdeep Singh, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Mohammad Shami.

179.title: Impose â¹1,000 fine for not wearing seat belts: Centre to K'taka Police
179.article_body: Union Ministry of Road Transport and Highways has directed the Karnataka Police to increase the penalty for not wearing seat belts on four-wheelers, even to passengers in rear seats, from â¹500 to â¹1,000. Karnataka has recorded 31 deaths every day due to road accidents in 2022, till August end. Earlier, Mumbai Police made wearing seat belts compulsory from November 1.

180.title: Doctors told I had 2% chance to live: Matthew Perry on drug abuse in 2018
180.article_body: 'Friends' actor Matthew Perry said that in 2018, after his colon burst due to the overuse of opioids, doctors said he had a 2% chance to live. He said he spent two weeks in coma and had to use a colostomy bag for nine months. "I was put on a thing called an ECMO machine...No one survives that," he added.

181.title: Man Utd defeat Spurs, Liverpool beat West Ham; Chelsea held by Brentford
181.article_body: Manchester United and Liverpool registered wins in their respective matches in the Premier League on Wednesday night. United produced a dominant 2-0 win over Tottenham Hotspur, while Liverpool earned a narrow 1-0 victory over West Ham United. Chelsea were held to a 0-0 draw by Brentford, but they remain fourth on the points table with 20 points from 10 games.

182.title: Hyderabad's Qutb Shahi mosque land restored, â¹5 lakh given for damage
182.article_body: A survey of Hyderabad's Qutb Shahi mosque land was held on Wednesday and after verification, it was ascertained that the disputed land belongs to mosque. This comes after a group belonging to a particular community claimed that government had allocated some land there for a temple. A decision to sanction â¹5 lakh to repair the damaged wall was also taken.

183.title: MSRTC to give â¹5,000 as Diwali gift to all of its 87,000 employees
183.article_body: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) on Wednesday announced a Diwali 'bhet' or gift of â¹5,000 for all of its around 87,000 employees. The amount will be credited to the bank accounts of the employees soon, said the company. This comes after the state government granted an aid of â¹45 crore to the MSRTC.

184.title: Tracxn Technologies' shares to make market debut today
184.article_body: Shares of Tracxn Technologies Limited will debut in the stock market on Thursday and will be listed and admitted to dealings in the list of 'B' group of securities in a Special Pre-open Session. Tracxn had raised â¹309 crore through its public issue and was subscribed just 2.01 times during October 10-12. Its price band was at â¹75-â¹80 per share.

185.title: TMC's rule in West Bengal will be over in few months: BJP's Suvendu
185.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari on Wednesday said the rule of the TMC in the state will end in a few months, saying police would not be able to save it any longer. "Police have become slaves and they are protecting this corrupt regime...days of this regime are over. Their rule will be over in a few months," Adhikari added.

186.title: Sherlyn files police complaint against Sajid Khan, seeks his removal from 'Bigg Boss'
186.article_body: Sherlyn Chopra has filed a police complaint against filmmaker Sajid Khan while seeking his removal from 'Bigg Boss 16'. She said while she has been requesting 'Bigg Boss' makers to eliminate him, there has been no response. Sherlyn had accused Sajid of flashing his private part at her, asking her to rate it on a scale of 0 to 10.

187.title: I feel change is definitely happening: Yami on nepotism
187.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam opened up about nepotism in Bollywood and said she feels that the "change is definitely happening now". "What happened in the past is done! We have to focus on now to make this place better with brilliant films & talent, regardless of our respective backgrounds," she said. Yami also shared her opinion on South vs North debate.

188.title: If India don't win this T20 WC, it won't be for lack of preparation: Gavaskar
188.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said if India don't win the ongoing T20 World Cup, it won't be for the lack of preparation. "Not only have they gone to Australia almost three weeks before their first game, but they're also playing practice games against good sides," added Gavaskar. "Apart from these...they also played six T20Is at home," he further said.

189.title: IT professional's Apple laptops, iPad stolen from parked car in Pune
189.article_body: An IT professional lost items worth around â¹1.45 lakh, including two Apple laptops, one iPad and one wireless AirPods, which he left in a parked car in Pune. The victim, who had gone for Diwali shopping, returned to find the rear windshield of his car broken and the bag containing the gadgets missing, according to police.

190.title: Pune Police van gets stuck under height barrier, officials cut and remove it
190.article_body: A police van got stuck under a height restriction barrier at Pune's Koregaon Park on Wednesday. The barrier was later removed using a cutter, Koregaon Park Police Station officials said. "We rushed to the spot after getting the alert...cleared the stuck vehicle and traffic was resumed," said a traffic police official. "The van's driver misjudged the barrier's height," police added.

191.title: Waterlogging in parts of Bengaluru after heavy rain; vehicles damaged
191.article_body: Severe waterlogging was reported in parts of Bengaluru after heavy rain lashed the city on Wednesday due to which several cars parked on the road were damaged. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) had issued a yellow alert, warning of heavy rain, for Bengaluru for the next three days. People shared videos of the waterlogged roads on social media.

192.title: 80% chance of rain in Melbourne during India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match on October 23
192.article_body: As per Australia's Bureau of Meteorology, the chance of rain in Melbourne during India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match on October 23 is high. The department has predicted that there is 80% chance of showers, most likely in the evening, in Melbourne on Sunday. India-Pakistan match is scheduled to begin at 7 pm (local time) and 1.30 PM (IST).

193.title: Musk says he's 'obviously overpaying' for Twitter but 'excited' for $44 bn deal
193.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk on Wednesday said that while he was "obviously overpaying" to acquire Twitter for $44 billion, he was "excited" to own the social media site. He added, "Though myself and the other investors are obviously overpaying for Twitter right now, the long-term potential for Twitter is an order of magnitude greater than its current value."

194.title: Faridabad Police arrests man for cheating 70 people of crores with 'jobs'
194.article_body: Faridabad Police arrested a 28-year-old man for cheating at least 70 people of crores of rupees by posing as a Home Ministry official and offering them jobs with the ministry. The man used to meet all potential aspirants near the North and South Blocks of the Central Secretariat, police added. Notably, the accused was arrested from Ranchi in Jharkhand.

195.title: Giant dome of Indonesia mosque collapses after major fire during renovation
195.article_body: The giant dome of the Jakarta Islamic Centre Grand Mosque in Indonesia collapsed on Wednesday after a major fire broke out during its renovation. Social media footage showed the moment the mosque's dome collapsed. Officials said that there were no casualties, adding that at least ten fire engines were dispatched to the scene, Indonesia media reported.

196.title: Man climbs atop Mumbai's Grant Road skywalk, causes traffic jam
196.article_body: A 24-year-old man, said to be heavily drunk, climbed on the roof of Mumbai's Grant Road skywalk, which led to a traffic jam at Nana Chowk on Wednesday morning. It took about 90 minutes for the fire brigade to bring him down. The man kept blabbering that he wanted to meet his guru or something, said an official.

197.title: BBMP to terminate contract of pothole filling agency over unfilled potholes
197.article_body: After a 50-year-old woman died in an accident while trying to avoid a pothole in Bengaluru, the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike officials said they're terminating the contract of the pothole filling agency, American Road Technology and Solutions (ART&S). "We have issued two notices to the company seeking an explanation as to why the potholes were not filled," an official said.

198.title: Body of teen with face crushed using stone found in Navi Mumbai
198.article_body: The body of a 17-year-old boy was found in a playground at Kopar Khairane in Navi Mumbai on Wednesday. The deceased has been identified as Sahil Shantaram Gole, a Class 12 student. "There was a big stone lying beside him, and his face was covered with blood, we suspect someone crushed his face with that stone," a police official said.

199.title: Croma aims to make people's dreams come true in Festival of Dreams sale
199.article_body: Diwali is around the corner and it's the time to fulfil your festive dreams, shared Croma, urging customers to relish this golden opportunity to get their favourite appliances and gadgets home at a price like never before from Croma. Customers can avail exciting offers during the Festival of Dreams sale at Croma stores or on Croma.com.

200.title: Moosewala murder accused Deepak Tinu who fled from custody arrested in Alwar
200.article_body: The Delhi Police's Special Cell on Wednesday arrested gangster Deepak Tinu, an accused in singer Sidhu Moosewala's murder, from Rajasthan's Alwar. Deepak had escaped from police custody in Punjab's Mansa on October 1. "Five grenades and two automatic pistols have been recovered from his possession," Special Commissioner of Police (Special Cell) HGS Dhaliwal said. He is being brought to Delhi.

201.title: Karnataka CID arrests 37 teachers in recruitment scam after raids at 51 locations
201.article_body: The CID in Karnataka on Wednesday arrested 37 teachers who were allegedly appointed illegally in the teacher recruitment process in 2012-13 and 2014-15. The arrests were made after raids at 51 locations across the state by 30 special teams formed by CID. As many as 24 arrests were made in Kolar, five each in Bengaluru South and Chitradurga.

202.title: First known map of night sky found hidden in Medieval parchment, pic surfaces
202.article_body: Scientists have discovered the earliest-known map of night sky from a monastery in Egypt in the form of parchment, according to a report in Nature. It seems to be part of the long-lost star catalogue of the astronomer Hipparchus. James Evans, a historian of astronomy at the University of Puget Sound in Washington, described the find as "rare" and "remarkable".

203.title: 8 killed, 18 injured in blasts at prison in Myanmar
203.article_body: Eight people, including three officials, were killed in two blasts at a Myanmar prison on Wednesday, said an information team of the country's junta. Eighteen people were reportedly injured. The Insein Prison in Yangon holds thousands of political prisoners, including Japanese journalist Toru Kubota. The blasts occurred in the queue area where visitors were delivering parcels for inmates.

204.title: OPECâs decision to cut oil production is a mistake, favours Russia: US
204.article_body: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) and its allies' decision to cut oil production is a mistake which favours Russia, the US has said. "We believe that the decision is going to hurt and harm lower-income economies," White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre said. Meanwhile, the OPEC has defended the move, citing economic reasons.

205.title: Congress has to be built at grassroots level: Mallikarjun Kharge's son Priyank
205.article_body: Priyank Kharge said his father Mallikarjun Kharge, who was elected as the Congress President, will strengthen the party by consulting everyone and giving preference to party workers. Priyank added that the party has to be built at the grassroots level and that collective effort will be made to win the elections and form governments in various states.

206.title: Tiger mauls 2 shepherds to death in forest in Maha's Chandrapur
206.article_body: A tiger mauled two shepherds to death in Chichpalli forest range in Maharashtra's Chandrapur district on Wednesday, a senior forest officer said. The deceased, identified as 53-year-old Nanaji Nikose and 55-year-old Diwru Waslekar, had gone into the forest with cattle when the tiger attacked them. The kin of the deceased were given initial ex-gratia by forest officials, an official said.

207.title: Video of Ramiz saying 'Pakistan cricket can collapse without India's support' resurfaces
207.article_body: A video of PCB chief Ramiz Raja saying Pakistan cricket can collapse without India's support resurfaced. In the video, Ramiz states Indian business houses run Pakistan cricket, adding, "If tomorrow Indian PM decides he won't allow funding to Pakistan...PCB can collapse." This comes after Pakistan threatened to boycott World Cup 2023 if India don't travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup.

208.title: Indian-origin Suella Braverman resigns as UK Home Secretary over 'mistake', criticises govt
208.article_body: Indian-origin UK Home Secretary Suella Braverman resigned on Wednesday after a "mistake" in using her private email for ministerial communication. She further wrote that she had concerns over the direction of PM Liz Truss' government. "Not only have we broken key pledges...but I have had serious concerns about this government's commitment to honouring manifesto commitments," Braverman added.

209.title: Alia planned to join drama school, 'SOTY' came out of nowhere: Soni Razdan
209.article_body: As Alia Bhatt completed 10 years in Bollywood on Wednesday, mother Soni Razdan recalled how she bagged her debut film 'Student of the Year' out of nowhere while she was busy with a diploma course. "The plan was...to go to a drama school and then...try to get a role," Soni said. "Acting in...movie was a distant dream," she said.

210.title: 84 lakh kg waste collected since launch of Swachh Bharat 2022: Thakur
210.article_body: Union minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday said 84 lakh kg of waste has been collected across the country since the launch of Swachh Bharat 2022 campaign. His comment came after he launched a cleanliness drive in Delhi as part of the Swachh Bharat campaign. "This year, we've set a target to collect 100 lakh kg of waste plastic," he said.

211.title: NCPCR summons Amazon India head over 'funding' to All India Mission
211.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has summoned Amit Agarwal, the country head of Amazon India, over alleged funding to All India Mission. NCPCR has warned of legal action if Agarwal fails to appear before it on November 1. The commission has alleged that All India Mission is being involved in unlawful practices by illegally converting children.

212.title: COVID-19 is still a global health emergency: WHO
212.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) on Wednesday said that COVID-19 remains a global emergency, nearly three years after it was first declared as one. "Although the public perception is pandemic is over in some parts of the world, it remains a public health event that continues to adversely and strongly affect the health of the world's population," the WHO added.

213.title: Bihar CM in touch with BJP, may go for a tie-up with party again: Kishor
213.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor on Wednesday claimed that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar is in touch with the BJP and he may go for a tie-up with the party again if situation demands so. "He's in touch with...BJP through his party MP and Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairperson Harivansh ji," Kishor said. He has kept a line open with BJP, he added.

214.title: Man arrested for raping neighbour's 12-yr-old daughter in Maharashtra
214.article_body: A 41-year-old man from Kalyan in Maharashtra's Thane district has been arrested for allegedly raping the 12-year-old daughter of his neighbour, police said on Wednesday. A police official said the girl was playing outside her house when the man lured her to his house and raped her. The girl later experienced abdominal pains and confided in her mother, he added.

215.title: Aeroplanes to be manufactured in Gujarat soon: PM Modi
215.article_body: While addressing a gathering in Rajkot after launching a host of projects, PM Narendra Modi said that aeroplanes will soon be manufactured in Gujarat. While praising the engineering industry in Rajkot, he added that spare parts of aeroplanes will be made there. PM Modi is on a two-day visit to his home state Gujarat.

216.title: India asks its citizens to leave Ukraine at the earliest as war escalates
216.article_body: India on Wednesday advised its citizens to avoid travelling to Ukraine, citing "deteriorating security situation" in the country. "Indian citizens, including students...are advised to leave Ukraine at the earliest by available means," the Indian Embassy in Ukraine said. This came after Russian President Vladimir Putin introduced martial law in four Ukrainian regions he says Russia has annexed.

217.title: 'Flash' actor Ezra Miller faces 26-yr jail for liquor theft, pleads not guilty
217.article_body: 'Flash' actor Ezra Miller, who's charged with burglary for allegedly stealing bottles of liquor from a neighbour's home, has pleaded not guilty to charges in a Vermont court. The actor will face 26 years in prison if convicted. The next hearing on the case is scheduled for January 13. Miller was charged with burglary based on surveillance footage and witnesses.

218.title: Former Samajwadi Party MLA Imran Masood joins BSP
218.article_body: Former Samajwadi Party (SP) MLA Imran Masood joined the Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) on Wednesday. This comes nine months after he left Congress to join SP. Welcoming him, BSP chief Mayawati tweeted, "Imran Masood is a well-known name in...politics of Uttar Pradesh...He has left the SP and has promised to work with full force and good intentions in the BSP."

219.title: 3 killed as AC's compressor explodes at RCF plant in Alibag
219.article_body: Three workers died and three others were injured when an air-conditioner's compressor burst at the Rashtriya Chemicals and Fertilizers (RCF) plant in Alibag, Maharashtra on Wednesday, an official said. The workers were repairing the AC when it exploded. "Further investigation was underway and we will register a case at the Alibag Police Station," the official said.

220.title: US says Russia oil price cap will not be replicated against OPEC
220.article_body: A US Treasury official said that the US-led initiative from the Group of Seven countries to cap prices of Russian crude oil will not be replicated against OPEC producers. The official added that US has communicated its reassurance to the OPEC nations. OPEC+ previously announced that it would cut production by 2 million barrels per day (bpd) to balance markets.

221.title: Leegality raises $5 mn in Series A round led by IIFL Fintech Fund
221.article_body: Document infrastructure platform Leegality has raised $5 million in its Series A funding round led by IIFL Fintech Fund and Mumbai Angels. The investors had invested an undisclosed amount in the company's pre-Series A funding round in 2021. The Gurugram-based company was founded in 2016 and allows Indian businesses to sign and manage their paperwork with customers and vendors.

222.title: Russia to impose martial law in recently annexed Ukrainian regions
222.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday said martial law will be imposed in the four Ukrainian regions that were annexed last month. Putin said, "We are working on solving very complex, large-scale tasks to ensure a reliable future for Russia." Russia formally annexed Ukraine's Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhzhia regions through referendums which the West dismissed as a sham.

223.title: Punjab govt mulls hiring 8-10 seater charter aircraft for VIP use
223.article_body: The Punjab government has floated a tender to hire a Dassault Falcon 2000 fixed-wing aircraft for VIP use for one year. An official statement said the charter aircraft must seat a minimum of eight-ten passengers. Questioning the need for an aircraft, Congress leader Partap Singh Bajwa said the state government already has a five-seater Bell 429 helicopter worth â¹38 crore.

224.title: Delhi LG permits probe into crime syndicate run by conman from jail: Report
224.article_body: Delhi LG VK Saxena has reportedly allowed Delhi Police's Economic Offences Wing (EOW) to probe the role of 82 prison officials in the organised crime syndicate run by conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar from jail. The LG also claimed that the Prison Department was under now jailed AAP minister Satyendar Jain. The EOW said that seven officers have been arrested.

225.title: Bombay HC directs Axis Finance to approach NCLT over Essel Group debt
225.article_body: The Bombay High Court told Axis Finance to raise its concerns over the merger between Zee Entertainment Enterprises and Sony Pictures Networks India before the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT). NCLT is set to hear the matter on November 3. Three Essel Group companies- Primat Infrapower, Multiventures and Cyquator Media Services, owe nearly â¹150 crore to Axis Finance.

226.title: JPMorgan to launch platform to connect startups with investors
226.article_body: JPMorgan Chase will launch a platform to connect startups with venture capital investors. The bank said that the platform, Capital Connect, will simplify the fundraising process and will cater to the financing needs of startups from an early stage. Capital Connect will help startup founders connect with investors and build virtual data rooms, the bank added.

227.title: 186 unmanned aerial vehicles spotted this year near Pakistan border in Punjab: BSF
227.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) has sighted 186 unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) near the International Border with Pakistan in Punjab this year till October 15. The number of UAVs spotted in Punjab near the border was 47 in 2020 and 64 in 2021. The number of UAVs spotted this year in Jammu and Rajasthan was 20 each.

228.title: Delhi CM recommends Raaj Kumar Anand for inclusion in his Cabinet
228.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday said he has recommended Patel Nagar MLA Raaj Kumar Anand's name to Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena for inclusion in his Cabinet. The move comes after Rajendra Pal Gautam resigned as the Social Welfare Minister earlier this month. Anand is a first-time MLA and is a post-graduate in political science.

229.title: Tamil Nadu's debt grew by 22.43% to â¹5,18,796 crore in 2020-21: CAG Report
229.article_body: A Comptroller and Auditor General of India report, tabled in the Tamil Nadu assembly, said the state's debt grew by 22.43% in 2020-21 to â¹5,18,796 crore. The report said the capital expenditure of â¹36,902 crore and the high fiscal deficit for that year indicated utilisation of borrowing for financing revenue expenditure. The Debt-Gross State Domestic Product ratio was at 26.94%.

230.title: How do the T20 World Cup 2022 points tables read after Day 4?
230.article_body: After the Day 4 of first round matches at T20 World Cup 2022, Netherlands are on top of Group A points table with four points. They're followed by Namibia (2), Sri Lanka (2) and UAE (0). Each of the four teams in Group B have accumulated two points each, with Scotland on top with a superior net run-rate

231.title: Heavy rainfall warning issued for several states for next few days, list released
231.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy rainfall warning for several states and UTs. It is very likely over Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Kerala from October 20 to October 22. Further, it is very likely over Karnataka and Lakshadweep on October 20. Odisha may witness heavy rainfall on October 23.

232.title: Gangster killed for pulling beard of rival in jail in J'khand: 3 held
232.article_body: The main accused in the murder of gangster Ranjit Singh in Jharkhand's Jamshedpur was arrested on Wednesday, police said. The accused, Sarabjit Singh, killed Ranjit because he had pulled Sarabjit's beard when they were in jail, said Senior SP (East Singhbhum district) Prabhat Kumar. The accused plotted to kill Ranjit after the two were released from jail, he added.

233.title: 7 Odisha districts, including Puri, on alert over possible impact of Cyclone Sitrang
233.article_body: Authorities have asked seven districts in Odisha to maintain high alert in the wake of the possible impact of Cyclone Sitrang. The districts that have been alerted are Ganjam, Puri, Khordha, Jagatsinghpur, Bhadrak, Kendrapara and Balasore. The cyclonic storm is likely to develop over the west-central Bay of Bengal around the weekend.

234.title: I won't have a job if I violate Wipro's integrity, harassment policy: Chairman
234.article_body: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji said, "There is a zero-one (company) policy for any form of integrity violation, any form of harassment." He added, "You can be me in the company, and I won't have a job if I violate one of those two." He also revealed the company fired a senior employee in 10 minutes for a "huge integrity violation".

235.title: Experimental Ebola vaccines to reach Uganda in 2 weeks: WHO official
235.article_body: Experimental Ebola vaccines will reach Uganda in around two weeks, a World Health Organization (WHO) official said on Wednesday, as the latest outbreak of the disease has claimed 24 lives in the country. The trial vaccines include the Oxford dose, which is being produced by the Serum Institute of India. The Sudan strain of Ebola is currently circulating in Uganda.

236.title: Former T'gana MP Boora Narsaiah Goud joins BJP after quitting BRS
236.article_body: Former Telangana MP Boora Narsaiah Goud on Wednesday joined the BJP days after he quit Bharat Rashtra Samithi (formerly Telangana Rashtra Samithi). "As a politician, I was not able to do my duties in the party," Goud said. Welcoming Goud into the party, Union minister Bhupendra Yadav said, "Schemes in Telangana do not go beyond the KCR family."

237.title: No one big or small in Cong, we've to unitedly fight fascists: Kharge
237.article_body: Congress President-elect Mallikarjun Kharge on Wednesday stated that all party workers need to work together to strengthen the Congress, adding, "Nobody is big or small in the party." The 80-year-old added, "We've to unitedly fight against the fascist forces that are attacking the democratic institutions under the garb of communalism." Kharge received 7,897 votes in the party Presidential poll.

238.title: NASAâs Lucy spacecraft spotted in sky as it passed by Earth on its way to Mars
238.article_body: NASA's Lucy spacecraft, which is all set to explore the Trojan asteroids, flew past the Earth from a distance of 350 km above its surface on Sunday. Several astronomers spotted it shining bright in the night sky and also shared the pictures. The spacecraft is heading towards Mars now and will make another gravity assist pass by Earth in 2024.

239.title: US repatriates 307 antiquities worth $4 million to India
239.article_body: The US has repatriated 307 antiquities, worth nearly $4 million, to India. Of the repatriated antiquities, majority were seized from disgraced dealer Subhash Kapoor. Kapoor is said to have looted and trafficked items from Afghanistan, Cambodia, India, Indonesia, Myanmar, Nepal, Pakistan and Thailand. Among the returned pieces is Arch Parikara, which dates back to approximately the 12th century.

240.title: Expect cooperative efforts from Pakistan to fight terrorism: US
240.article_body: The US expects cooperative efforts from Pakistan to fight regional and global terrorism, the President Joe Biden-led administration has said. "Few countries have suffered from terrorism like Pakistan...we seek a strong partnership with Pakistan on counter-terrorism and expect sustained action against all militant and terrorist groups," said US State Department Deputy Spokesperson Vedant Patel.

241.title: 'Jobless Congress': Karnataka CM Bommai on 'SayCM' campaign
241.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday criticised the Congress for its 'SayCM' campaign and called the party "jobless". "Let them do, let them do more...We have a responsibility to run the government and do public welfare work," Bommai said. "We believe that our work should speak rather than us speaking, and [we] are doing our work," he added.

242.title: Looking forward to working with Kharge to strengthen united oppn: Pawar
242.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday congratulated Mallikarjun Kharge on winning the Congress party's Presidential elections and said he was looking forward to working with him to strengthen unity among Opposition parties. "I extend my best wishes to him for a successful and inspiring tenure," Pawar tweeted. Mallikarjun Kharge defeated Shashi Tharoor in the Congress Presidential elections.

243.title: Actress Vaishali Takkar's ex-boyfriend, who was named in her suicide note, arrested
243.article_body: Rahul Navlani, the ex-boyfriend named by actress Vaishali Takkar in her alleged suicide note was arrested on Wednesday by the Madhya Pradesh Police. The note recovered from her home suggested that she was stressed and was being harassed by a former boyfriend, according to police. Navlani was harassing her after coming to know about her marriage plans, her family alleged.

244.title: Delhi's air quality likely to turn 'very poor' ahead of Diwali; curbs imposed
244.article_body: The air quality in Delhi is likely to turn "very poor" from October 22. The Commission for Air Quality Management has directed authorities to enact stage two of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP), a set of anti-air pollution measures. Under this stage, the use of coal and firewood and diesel generator sets will be banned.

245.title: Woman dies after falling from 2nd floor while cleaning window in Mumbai
245.article_body: A 66-year-old woman died after falling from a flat on second floor of a building while cleaning window in Mulund on Tuesday. According to police, Sulochana Soshte, who works as a domestic help at the flat, was cleaning the sliding kitchen windows when the iron grill outside came out, making her fall. She had sustained severe head and leg injuries.

246.title: What's the Family Physician Concept that'll be launched in Andhra on Oct 21?
246.article_body: Andhra Pradesh government will soft launch its Family Physician Concept on October 21 to reduce load on secondary and tertiary hospitals. Under the programme, a medical officer will visit village health centres twice a month to provide quality healthcare. They'll also coordinate to provide referral treatment and Arogyasri services. The initiative will be officially launched in January 2023.

247.title: RBI rate hikes will help reduce inflation: MPC member Ashima Goyal
247.article_body: RBI Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) member Ashima Goyal said RBI's efforts to keep a check on price rise by increasing interest rates will help in reducing inflation. Goyal added that inflation will fall below 6% next year. ''International commodity prices are softening with the global slowdown and supply chain bottlenecks have reduced,'' she said.

248.title: Time to teach lesson to those who abuse, insult Gujarat: PM Modi
248.article_body: Addressing a rally in Gujarat's Junagadh, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that it's time to teach a lesson to those people who constantly abuse and insult the state. Without naming anyone, he added that some political parties think their work is incomplete if they do not abuse Gujarat and Gujaratis. "Should we forgive those who tarnish Gujarat's image?" Modi asked.

249.title: Policeman performs CPR on farmer who collapsed due to cardiac arrest; video surfaces
249.article_body: A policeman in Andhra Pradesh saved a farmer's life after he collapsed on a bridge due to cardiac arrest during the Maha Padyatra organised by Amravati farmers. A video shared by Andhra Pradesh Police showed Circle Inspector Rajamahendravaram applying pressure on the farmer's chest while others helped him. The farmer was immediately rushed to a hospital for further treatment.

250.title: Meghan Markle wears T-shirt with Farsi slogan to support anti-hijab protests in Iran
250.article_body: Meghan Markle recently extended her support to women in Iran amid ongoing anti-hijab protests. She recently met Archewell President, Mandana Dayani and Executive Vice President of Global Communications, Ashley Hansen in Los Angeles. Both Mandana and Ashley are Iranian. Mandana shared pictures with Meghan where the latter is seen wearing a black T-shirt with the Farsi words 'Women, Life, Freedom'.

251.title: OYO, MakeMyTrip, Goibibo fined â¹392 crore for unfair trade practices
251.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Wednesday imposed a penalty of more than â¹392 crore on online hotel-booking platforms MakeMyTrip, Goibibo and OYO. The CCI was investigating the companies since 2019 following allegations by a hotel body that MakeMyTrip gave special treatment to OYO on its platform. The CCI also directed MakeMyTrip and Goibibo to amend their market behaviour.

252.title: Aramane Giridhar named next Defence Secretary, Sanjay Malhotra new Revenue Secretary
252.article_body: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways Secretary Aramane Giridhar has been appointed the next Defence Secretary. He will take over as Defence Secretary from Ajay Kumar upon his superannuation on October 31, 2022, the government said. Further, Sanjay Malhotra, Secretary, Department of Financial Services, Ministry of Finance has been appointed the next Revenue Secretary.

253.title: Woman thrashes man with slippers, kicks him at Chhattisgarh hospital, video surfaces
253.article_body: A video surfaced online showing a woman thrashing a man with slippers and slapping and kicking him at a hospital in Chhattisgarh. As per reports, the woman beat him up after he questioned her why she turned off the cooler. Reports further said that the man was asked to leave the hospital later as he didn't have any relatives admitted.

254.title: UGC asks report from GD Goenka University on clashes between students
254.article_body: After clashes between Indian and Nigerian students at the GD Goenka University in Haryana's Sohna, the University Grants Commission (UGC) has sought a report from the varsity. "The university has been directed to take appropriate action," UGC Joint Secretary Surender Singh said. Six students were reported to be injured in the incident last week.

255.title: NEP will pull India out of English slave mentality: PM Modi
255.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday stated that the New Education Policy (NEP) will pull India out of the slave mentality surrounding the English language. He added, "Many young talents...could not become doctors and engineers because they were not well-versed in English." He pointed out that English, which was considered a criterion of being intellectual, is just a medium of communication.

256.title: Maharashtra reports 18 cases of XBB sub-variant of Omicron in 15 days
256.article_body: Maharashtra reported at least 18 cases of XBB sub-variant of Omicron in the first 15 days of October, the state health department said on Wednesday. As many as 13 of these cases were reported from Pune, two each from Nagpur and Thane and one from Akola district. All these cases are mild, as per primary information.

257.title: Who doesn't want to be a Rohit Shetty cop: Sidharth Malhotra
257.article_body: Sidharth Malhotra, who will be making his OTT debut with Rohit Shetty's 'Indian Police Force', said for a young star, there cannot be a doubt about working with Shetty. "He presents Hindi film heroes in...macho way," Sidharth said. "When he came up with...OTT idea, I was game. Who doesnât want to be a cop in...Rohit Shetty universe?" he added.

258.title: Simply stunning: Mahindra on India's digital payments ecosystem
258.article_body: Industrialist Anand Mahindra on Wednesday said India's success in creating a unique digital payments ecosystem is "simply stunning". "Leaders always find new and different pathways; the rest of the world follows..." Mahindra tweeted while sharing a picture showing digital payments options available in different countries. India ranks amongst the top countries in the list shared by Mahindra.

259.title: Man warns of bomb blasts in mall, theatre, hotel in Mumbai; turns out to be a hoax
259.article_body: The Mumbai Police received a fake threat call on its helpline number 112 on Tuesday night and the caller said that three bomb blasts will occur in the city. Several police teams searched the places, including a mall in Andheri, PVR Mall Juhu and Sahara Hotel Airport. A police officer said that the hoax caller has not been booked yet.

260.title: AIADMK leaders arrested for protesting without permission in Chennai
260.article_body: Several AIADMK legislators, including the party's interim General Secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami, were arrested in Chennai on Wednesday for protesting near the Valluvar Kottam monument without permission. The AIADMK faction led by Palaniswami is protesting against Tamil Nadu Assembly Speaker M Appavu allotting the Deputy Leader of the Opposition chair in the Assembly to O Panneerselvam.

261.title: Committed to launch open offer for NDTV: Adani Group on missing deadline
261.article_body: Adani Group on Wednesday said it's committed to launching an open offer to acquire an additional 26% stake in NDTV from minority shareholders after it missed the date for the offer's launch (October 17). Adani Group asked SEBI to provide comments on its draft open offer letter. Adani had proposed to acquire the stake at an offer price of â¹294/share.

262.title: Deal more important than date: UK trade minister on India trade deal
262.article_body: Britainâs Trade Policy Minister Greg Hands said a free trade agreement (FTA) that works for both sides is more important than the date when it is signed. Hands said Trade Secretary Kemi Badenoch is having regular dialogue with Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal to build an âeven warmer and more productive relationship.â

263.title: Old video of Vaishali Takkar saying 'life is precious' surfaces days after her suicide
263.article_body: Days after actress Vaishali Takkar's suicide, an old video that shows her saying 'Life is precious' has resurfaced. Vaishali had shot it at a hospital where she revealed she was admitted due to jaundice and viral fever. She went on to say people shouldn't waste time eating junk food, partying till late at night and drinking due to relationship issues.

264.title: Fitness startup Cult.fit aims for IPO in 12-18 months
264.article_body: Fitness startup Cult.fit is aiming for an Initial Public Offering (IPO) in 12-18 months, according to senior executives of the company. Founded in 2016 by Mukesh Bansal and Ankit Nagori, Cult.fit has raised close to $685 million to date from investors such as Tata, Accel, Zomato and Temasek. In the last few years, Cult.fit has also made 14 acquisitions.

265.title: 35-year-old gym trainer sitting on a chair dies of heart attack in UP
265.article_body: A 35-year-old gym trainer who was sitting on a chair suddenly shook backwards and died after suffering a heart attack in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. According to his friends, he recently began working on a new real estate business but he used to work out at the gym regularly. Some reports also said he had a mild fever for two days.

266.title: Punjab not taking adequate steps to prevent stubble burning: Centre
266.article_body: The Centre on Wednesday stated that the Punjab government was not taking adequate steps to prevent stubble burning. The Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change noted that incidents of farm fires are increasing rapidly in the state. The use of Pusa bio-decomposer, which turns stubble into manure in 15-20 days, needs to be enhanced in Punjab, the ministry added.

267.title: Have done films with cringe-worthy moments in VFX: Varun Dhawan
267.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan said he has done films that had "cringe-worthy" moments in VFX. "I couldn't say it back then, but now, I feel a little more responsible," he stated. Varun will next feature in 'Bhediya'. "There was a time, even I thought with an arrogance that everything was working. But then, there is always room to improve," he added.

268.title: Denied money for liquor, drunk man kills mother & injures wife in UP
268.article_body: A 28-year-old drunk man allegedly killed his mother and injured his wife in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly during an argument that broke out after his wife refused to give him money for liquor on Tuesday. Police said Suraj was charging towards his wife while holding a knife when his mother tried to intervene. Thereafter, Suraj allegedly stabbed his mother several times.

269.title: Delhi HC rejects plea against symbol allotted to Uddhav's Shiv Sena faction
269.article_body: The Delhi High Court rejected the plea of the Samata Party against the 'flaming torch' symbol allotted by the Election Commission to Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena faction. Stating that the Samata Party had been derecognised in 2004, Justice Sanjeev Narula added that it contested elections recently on a different symbol. The Samata Party also appealed to the Election Commission.

270.title: Cong Presidential polls elections for 'Gandhi family's remote': BJP
270.article_body: BJP leader and Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij on Wednesday said that the Congress Presidential polls were elections for the "remote of the Gandhi family". "They had made Sitaram Kesri the President, then removed him from office. Subhas Chandra Bose was compelled to step down from the post of Congress President. Then he made his own party," he said.

271.title: School principal booked for negligence in 4-yr-old's rape case in Hyd
271.article_body: The principal of a DAV school in Hyderabad's Banjara Hills has been booked for negligence in the rape case of a four-year-old girl. The four-year-old was allegedly sexually assaulted by the principal's driver for two months. The driver had been reportedly entering the classrooms at the school and inappropriately touching female students and misbehaving with them.

272.title: 'Ye humein jail bhejenge, hum inhein school': AAP takes a jibe at PM Modi
272.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Deputy CM Manish Sisodia took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday, citing their 'education model'. Kejriwal tweeted a picture of Sisodia sitting with a bunch of kids in a school and a picture of PM Modi sitting with only five students. Sisodia tweeted, "Ye humein jail bhejege, hum inhein school bhejenge."

273.title: Gautam Adani plans Adani Enterprises' first retail bond: Report
273.article_body: Adani Enterprises is planning a maiden â¹1,000 crore ($121 million) bond sale to individual investors, according to a statement from Care Ratings. The bond sale will come on the back of the coal-to-ports conglomerate trying to expand beyond its traditional mainstay businesses of ports and power plants. Care Ratings have assigned the potential issuance an A+ score.

274.title: Newly elected Congress chief Kharge to take charge on Oct 26
274.article_body: Senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge, who has become the first non-Gandhi Congress chief in 24 years, will formally take charge on October 26. In his first address after being elected, Kharge thanked the party's interim chief Sonia Gandhi on behalf of all Congress workers. He also congratulated his opponent Shashi Tharoor.

275.title: Clear encroachments from public land in B'luru Urban in 3 months: HC to officials
275.article_body: The Karnataka High Court (HC) has directed officials to clear encroachments on the 67-acre public grazing land (gomala) in Anekal Taluk, Bengaluru Urban district, within three months. The court said a report must be submitted after the private parties are removed from the land. Reportedly, 306 houses were constructed on the 67 acres of land.

276.title: Sanjay Malhotra to succeed Tarun Bajaj as Revenue Secretary
276.article_body: The government has named Financial Services Secretary Sanjay Malhotra as successor of Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj, who retires on November 30. Malhotra will assume the post of Officer on Special Duty in the finance ministry's Department of Revenue. Registrar General of India and Census Commissioner in Ministry of Home Affairs, Vivek Joshi, will replace Malhotra as Financial Services Secretary.

277.title: Crackers can be burst from 8 pm-10 pm in Bengaluru: KSPCB
277.article_body: Karnataka State Pollution Control Board (KSPCB) has directed government agencies to ensure that crackers are burst between 8 pm and 10 pm in Bengaluru. KSPCB further permitted sale of green crackers and banned crackers that may contribute to sound and air pollution. All districts have been directed to measure air and sound pollution on seven days before and after Diwali.

278.title: I didn't drive out Tatas from Singur, it was CPM: WB CM Mamata
278.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday said that TMC didn't drive out Tatas from Singur, alleging that CPM was the party behind it. "They acquired land forcibly, I returned it to unwilling owners," she said. "There is no shortage of land. Why take land by force? We have done so many projects," Mamata added.

279.title: 50-year-old man beaten with broom for sporting moustache in Gujarat
279.article_body: A 50-year-old man was allegedly thrashed by two drunk men in Gujarat's Sanand for sporting a moustache. Narrating the incident, the man said, "The...accused came up to me and asked me why I've a moustache before hurling casteist abuses." When he asked why they should have an objection to his moustache, they began beating him with a broom.

280.title: CWC rescues 2 minors kept illegally at Murugha Math in Karnataka
280.article_body: Child Welfare Commission (CWC) has rescued two minors who were kept illegally at Sri Murugha Math in Karnataka's Chitradurga. The minors, including a four-and-a-half-year-old and a 17-year-old, were kept at the Math without any documentation and were rescued after the district's child protection officer notified CWC and filed a police complaint. Police has registered a case against four people.

281.title: Second airport for Chennai is the need of the hour: TN Minister
281.article_body: Tamil Nadu minister Thangam Thenarasu on Wednesday said a second airport for Chennai is the need of the hour. The Parandur airport would not come up at the expense of the villagers, Thenarasu said. "The existing airport at Chennai has the capacity to handle 22 million passengers per year and in 2028, it'll be enhanced to 35 million," he added.

282.title: Chinmayi shares pic of breastfeeding twins, says 'back & shoulders have a different voice'
282.article_body: Singer Chinmayi Sripada took to social media to share a picture of herself breastfeeding her twins at the same time. "Tandem feeding be like...the best thing in the world. Le back and shoulders have a different voice though," she wrote alongside the photo. "The joy and the killer back pain," an Instagram user commented on the photo.

283.title: Tar peels off at newly-built Kundalahalli underpass in B'luru; video surfaces
283.article_body: The tar surface of Bengaluru's newly-built Kundalahalli underpass has peeled off days after a portion of it caved in. A video of it, which was shared on Twitter, has also gone viral, with residents criticising the Bengaluru civic body for low-quality work. "Courts should intervene and punish the contractors and BBMP engineers for this mess," a Twitter user wrote.

284.title: New COVID variants expected with tendency to mutate: Ex-AIIMS chief
284.article_body: Former AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria on Wednesday said new variants of COVID-19 are expected which have the tendency to mutate. However, he said the situation is different now as people are vaccinated and have developed immunity against the virus. "If you are going out, especially in crowded places, [you] must wear a mask," he added.

285.title: Aamir Khan took my role in 'Taare Zameen Par' for himself: Akshaye Khanna
285.article_body: Actor Akshaye Khanna revealed filmmaker Amole Gupte had asked actor Aamir Khan to recommend the script of 'Taare Zameen Par' to Akshaye. "Aamir being Aamir, told him (Amole) 'I cannot recommend a script unless I hear it first...if I'll like it, I'll tell Akshaye'," he added. "I don't think I could've done a better job than Aamir," Akshaye stated.

286.title: Proud of you for making Cong Prez polls a real fight: Tharoor's son
286.article_body: Shashi Tharoor's son Ishaan has said that he is proud of his father for making the Congress Presidential election a "real fight" by throwing his hat in the ring. His tweet came shortly after Mallikarjun Kharge was declared the winner of the election. The total counted votes were 9,385, of which Kharge received 7,897 votes and Tharoor got 1,072 votes.

287.title: We must accept one another for who we are: Madhuri on playing a lesbian
287.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit who played a lesbian in the film 'Maja Ma' said that when she read the script, she felt it was a story that needed to be told. "I felt [it] was...needed to...share the message that it takes all kinds of people to make this world, and we must accept one another for who we are," she said.

288.title: Batten down the hatches: Jeff Bezos on possible recession in US
288.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos on Tuesday said "batten down the hatches" while sharing a video of Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon saying there's a good chance of a recession in the US. "Yep, the probabilities in this economy tell you to batten down the hatches," Bezos tweeted. "I think it's a time to be cautious," Solomon said in the video.

289.title: Neighbour arrested for raping 11-year-old girl in Delhi's Wazirabad
289.article_body: A 28-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping an 11-year-old girl in north Delhi's Wazirabad area on Tuesday. He also threatened the girl with dire consequences if she reported the matter to anyone, but she eventually narrated her ordeal to her mother. According to police, the accused and the girl's family share the same house, which is separated by rooms.

290.title: BJP MP to build â¹25-lakh auditorium in memory of Mulayam Singh in UP
290.article_body: BJP MP Virendra Singh Mast has announced plans to construct an auditorium in Uttar Pradesh in memory of former Chief Minister and Samajwadi Party (SP) founder Mulayam Singh Yadav. The MP has sanctioned â¹25 lakh from his MP Local Area Development Scheme fund for the task. The auditorium will be constructed on the premises of a district court in Ballia.

291.title: PM congratulates new Cong President Kharge, wishes him a 'fruitful tenure'
291.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday congratulated Mallikarjun Kharge for being elected as the Congress party's new President. "My best wishes to Shri Mallikarjun Kharge Ji for his new responsibility as President of INC," PM Modi tweeted. "May he have a fruitful tenure ahead," he added.

292.title: Two cycle-borne people killed as car rams into them in Gurugram
292.article_body: Two cycle-borne men were killed after a sedan allegedly rammed into them on the Golf Course Road in Gurugram on Tuesday evening, police said. One of the deceased's son said that his father's cycle got stuck under the car. He added that the car rammed into another cyclist who was sitting on his cycle near the gate of a society.

293.title: We'll examine West's proposal to cap Russian crude prices: Puri
293.article_body: Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said India will examine West's proposal to cap Russian crude oil prices. "I think there's an exemption for Japan for Sakhalin. Then there's crude which comes through pipeline, so they have exemptions...We'll have to look at it," Puri said. Sourcing crude oil will continue to be a "commercial decision" for oil marketing companies, he added.

294.title: People doubted Sidharth Malhotra, asked 'Can he do comedy?': Thank God director
294.article_body: 'Thank God' director Indra Kumar revealed people questioned his decision to cast actor Sidharth Malhotra in the film. "People would question me earlier, why him (Sidharth), can he do comedy? And I told them he could, 100%," he stated. Indra further called him a "sweet boy". "When you step into a new zone, this is bound to happen," Sidharth stated.

295.title: Apple may release foldable iPad by 2024, iPhone by 2025: Report
295.article_body: Apple will release foldable iPad by 2024, followed by a foldable iPhone in 2025, a CNBC report stated. Ben Wood, CCS Insight's Chief of Research, told CNBC, "Right now it doesn't make sense for Apple to make a foldable iPhone", calling it "super high risk". The report added that Apple could switch to in-house 5G modems for iPhones by 2025.

296.title: Founders should focus on valuable businesses, not valuation: Rishad Premji
296.article_body: Wipro Chairperson Rishad Premji has said that startup founders should focus on building valuable businesses rather than valuation, adding that journey to build sustainable businesses is long and complex. During a conclave, Premji said he feels disappointed when he meets founders for whom money is the most important aspect. "The choices are going to be...myopic and short-sighted," Premji added.

297.title: Tharoor will be ridiculed, shamed for taking on Gandhis: Amit Malviya
297.article_body: After Shashi Tharoor alleged "extremely serious irregularities" in the conduct of Congress' Presidential election process in Uttar Pradesh, BJP's Amit Malviya claimed that Tharoor will be ridiculed and shamed for taking on the Gandhis. "Tharoor is whining like a sore loser. Did he...expect elections in Congress to be free and fair?" Malviya tweeted, adding the worst is yet to come.

298.title: BJP government fond of potholes in Bengaluru: HD Kumaraswamy
298.article_body: JD(S) leader HD Kumaraswamy on Wednesday blamed the state BJP government for recent road accidents in Bengaluru which were caused by potholes. "The state BJP government is very fond of potholes. As long as there are potholes, money will flow into their pockets," he tweeted. Earlier, Bengaluru was called 'Silicon Valley', now it is called 'Pothole Valley', he said.

299.title: Nestle announces second interim dividend of â¹120 per share
299.article_body: Nestle India declared a second interim dividend of â¹120 per share. Nestle, in its filing, said its board of directors have recommended a second interim dividend on its entire issued, subscribed and paid-up share capital of 9,64,15,716 equity shares of the nominal value of â¹10 each. Nestle had announced its first dividend of â¹25 per share in May.

300.title: Drunk man sets restaurant on fire over incorrect chicken biryani order in New York
300.article_body: A video surfaced online showing a drunk man setting a Bangladeshi restaurant on fire over an incorrect chicken biryani order in New York. "I was very drunk...I bought chicken biryani. They didn't give me it. I was mad...I threw it out," the man identified as 49-year-old Choephel Norbu said. The arson causedÂ over $1,500 in damages to the restaurant.

301.title: Man beats policeman, tears his uniform after hitting 2 bikes with car in Haryana
301.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a man beating a policeman and tearing his uniform after hitting two bikes with car in Haryana's Ambala. The man was reportedly overspeeding when he hit the two bikes and was stopped by police. An FIR has been filed against the man and a probe is underway, police stated.

302.title: Was a dialogue: Urvashi clarifies âI Love Youâ video not related to Rishabh Pant
302.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela has clarified that her 'I love you' video that went viral recently is not related to cricketer Rishabh Pant. "My...video...was only from acting perspective and was a dialogue scene, not directed towards anyone or from any video call," Urvashi wrote on her Instagram story. Of late, trolls on social media have been accusing Urvashi of stalking Pant.

303.title: FDA seizes 400 kg adulterated ghee worth â¹3 lakh from Mumbai's Masjid Bandar
303.article_body: Maharashtra's Food and Drugs Administration (FDA) officials seized 400 kg adulterated ghee worth â¹3 lakh from a godown in Mumbai's Masjid Bandar area. Three food samples of ghee from the food establishment were taken for analysis. According to FDA officials, ahead of Diwali, FDA's Mumbai division has been vigilant about the food quality used and sold in the market.

304.title: 5 held for forging land documents, cheating land owners in Hyderabad
304.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested five persons who were allegedly preparing fake and forged documents to cheat land owners. The gang identified open land plots on the outskirts of the city and obtained details from the Sub Registrar Office (SRO) about the ownership, police said. Non-judicial stamp papers, fake Aadhaar cards, one car and mobile phones were seized from them.

305.title: Sex ratio of Pune city dropped from 949 to 913 in 2 years: PMC
305.article_body: According to data by Pune Municipal Corporation's health department, the sex ratio of Pune city has dropped from 949 in 2020 to 913 in 2022. A PMC official said the sex ratio had increased during COVID-19 lockdown mainly because many pregnant women had come to their homes in Pune. She further hinted that illegal abortions are taking place in Pune.

306.title: Dwayne Johnson jokes about becoming Britain's next Prime Minister
306.article_body: At the UK premiere of 'Black Adam', Hollywood actor Dwayne Johnson joked about becoming the next British Prime Minister. "Are you ready for another Johnson Prime Minister? Maybe Rock Prime Minister?" Johnson asked in response to a question. Johnson's comment has come days after he stated that the idea of contesting for US Presidential elections is "off the table".

307.title: SaaS startup Drivetrain AI raises $15 mn in Series A funding round
307.article_body: Financial planning startup Drivetrain AI has secured $15 million in Series A funding round from Elevation Capital, Jungle Ventures and Venture Highway. High net-worth Individuals like former Google executive Amit Singhal and Notion Co-founder Akshay Kothari participated in the round along with nearly 25 angel investors. The firm was co-founded by Alok Goel, Tarkeshwar Thakur and Saurav Bhagat.

308.title: Degree student ends life by jumping from 20th floor in Hyderabad
308.article_body: A degree student died by suicide by jumping from the 20th floor of a high-rise building in Hyderabad's Miyapur on Tuesday. She was a student of Nizam College and was staying with her grandparents for the last six months. In a note purportedly written by her, she stated that she wasn't willing to live and was upset with her life.

309.title: Man kills friend after fight over who would be cooking dinner in Hyd
309.article_body: A man, who works as a painter, reportedly killed his roommate after a fight over cooking dinner at their rented apartment in Hyderabad. The injured was rushed to a hospital, where doctors declared him brought dead. The accused, who had accompanied him to the hospital, fled after learning about his friend's death. He was, however, arrested at Nagpur railway station.

310.title: Didn't sleep night before 'SOTY' release, prayed in temple: Varun Dhawan
310.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan, who made his Bollywood debut with 'Student Of The Year (SOTY)', completed 10 years in the film industry on Wednesday. Speaking about the day before the film's release, Varun said, "I didn't sleep that night...I did a little prayer in the temple with my mom." The film was directed by Karan Johar and also featured Alia Bhatt.

311.title: Stray dogs eat corpse of woman near Kâtaka temple; authorities promise action
311.article_body: Two days after a 68-year-old woman's corpse, partially eaten by stray dogs, was found near Karnataka's Shree Kshetra Ganagapur Dattatreya temple, authorities said they would ensure such a "shameful incident" does not occur again. The woman, who was suspected to be mentally unstable, was abandoned on Saturday and died a few hours later, but her body went unnoticed until Sunday.

312.title: Class 7 question paper in Bihar govt schools terms Kashmir as separate country, pic surfaces
312.article_body: A Class 7 question paper in Bihar government schools termed Kashmir as a separate country. The paper had a question asking, "What are the people of the following countries called?" and listed Kashmir as one of the options. "The matter will be investigated & anyone responsible will be punished," Bihar Rural Development Minister Sharvan Kumar stated.

313.title: Bowler to be wary of isn't Shaheen, it's Haris Rauf: Aakash
313.article_body: Ahead of India's opening game at the T20 World Cup against Pakistan on Sunday, commentator Aakash Chopra has said the bowler to be wary of isn't Shaheen Afridi but Haris Rauf. "Afridi is getting close to his best but isn't there yet...Rauf will bowl the tougher overs and has the potential to make a difference," explained Chopra.

314.title: TRS leaders eyeing lands of Munugode constituency: T'gana BJP chief
314.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar on Tuesday alleged that TRS leaders are eyeing lands in Munugode constituency while campaigning for the by-polls. "In the name of...election campaign, TRS Dandupalyam gang is roaming around Munugode and inquiring about lands," he said. "TRS men are ready to distribute â¹40,000 for a house...That's the money earned by diverting central funds," he added.

315.title: Your political experience will strengthen INCâs ideology: Priyanka to Kharge
315.article_body: Soon after Mallikarjun Kharge won Congress Presidential poll on Wednesday, party leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra congratulated him, saying, "I am sure that your on-ground experience of political life will strengthen the ideology of the Indian National Congress (INC)." She tweeted, "Under your leadership, the Congress will continue to fight for the protection of the Constitution and democracy."

316.title: UltraTech's consolidated profit in Q2 falls 42% YoY to â¹759 crore
316.article_body: UltraTech Cement Limited reported a 42% decrease in its consolidated net profit at â¹759 crore for the quarter ended September 30, 2022, from â¹1,310 crore in the year-ago period. Its revenue from operations increased by 15.61% to â¹13,892.69 crore during the quarter. Sequentially, UltraTech's profit fell by 52% from â¹1,582 crore in the April-June period.

317.title: Powell sends ball out of ground with 104-m six, non-striker's 'shocked' reaction goes viral
317.article_body: West Indies' Rovman Powell smashed a 104-metre maximum, with the ball going out of the stadium during his team's match against Zimbabwe in T20 World Cup 2022. Powell slammed the six on a 137-kmph delivery bowled by Blessing Muzarabani in West Indies' last over. Non-striker batter Akeal Hosein was seen putting hands on his head, seemingly shocked by the hit.

318.title: We fired a senior employee in 10 mins for huge integrity violation: Wipro Chairman
318.article_body: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji, while speaking at an event on leadership lessons, revealed that a person among the top 20 people in his organisation was fired after being found to have committed a "huge integrity violation". "We made that decision in 10 minutes," said Premji. "When the times are tough...you have to make those tough calls," he added.

319.title: 32-yr-old Mumbai woman cheated of â¹2.70 lakh by fraud posing as doctor
319.article_body: A 32-year-old Mumbai resident, Hemali Mehta, was cheated of â¹2.70 lakh by a man who posed as a doctor and claimed to heal her father's legs. "The doctor started working and claimed to have removed 90 clots," police said. The fake doctor quoted â¹4,000 per clot as his fees. He asked Hemali not to mention the treatment to anyone.

320.title: Dutch government to spend up to $3.44 billion in military procurement
320.article_body: The Dutch government will invest up to $3.44 billion in military procurement. In a policy turnaround, the Dutch military will purchase a rocket artillery system and 10 howitzer cannons between 2023 and 2026. "The war on the European continent underlines the need to be able to act in all parts of the spectrum of violence," a Dutch minister said.

321.title: 21-yr-old Man Utd footballer Greenwood granted bail over attempted rape charge
321.article_body: Manchester United's 21-year-old footballer Mason Greenwood has been granted bail four days after being charged with attempted rape, engaging in controlling behaviour and assault. He was remanded in custody on Monday. Greenwood was initially arrested in January after his ex-girlfriend had released pictures of bruises on her body. He has been suspended by United pending investigation.

322.title: Sonia Gandhi meets & congratulates Kharge on becoming new Cong chief
322.article_body: Soon after Mallikarjun Kharge won Congress Presidential poll, outgoing party chief Sonia Gandhi on Wednesday visited his residence to congratulate him. Gandhi was accompanied by Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra. They also met Khargeâs wife Radhabai Kharge. Kharge defeated Shashi Tharoor in the Congress Presidential poll. Meanwhile, Tharoor also congratulated Congress President-elect Kharge.

323.title: CBI arrests BSF medical officer in J&K sub-inspectors recruitment scam
323.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Wednesday arrested a Border Security Force (BSF) medical officer, identified as Dr Karnail Singh, in connection with the question paper leak scam for recruitment of sub-inspectors (SI) to the Jammu and Kashmir Police. Singh is the ninth person arrested since the CBI registered a case in the matter on August 3.

324.title: Delhi Metro ridership rises to 87% of pre-pandemic levels: DMRC
324.article_body: The daily average ridership on the Delhi Metro increased to 87% of pre-pandemic levels in September, according to Delhi Metro Rail Corporation's (DMRC) latest data. In September, 47.3 lakh people travelled using Delhi Metro, compared to 6.19 lakh riders in September 2020, the data showed. In May this year, 39.5 lakh people travelled using Delhi Metro services.

325.title: Etihad appoints Antonoaldo Neves as new CEO after ADQ's takeover
325.article_body: After the Abu Dhabi government transferred Etihad Aviation Group's ownership to wealth fund ADQ, it appointed Antonoaldo Neves as the airline's new chief executive officer. Neves replaced Tony Douglas, who had been Etihad's CEO since 2018. Neves was CEO and a board member of TAP, Portugal's national carrier, from July 2017 to September 2020, according to his LinkedIn profile.

326.title: Fugitive OneCoin founder's associates face court for $4 bn fraud: Report
326.article_body: Three associates of fugitive founder of OneCoin, Ruja Ignatova, or "Cryptoqueen", faced German court on fraud and money laundering charges amounting to $4 billion, as per a report. A Munich-based lawyer connected to Ignatova was accused of transferring $19.7 million on her behalf to buy two London apartments. Enforcement agencies said OneCoin roped in users with fictitious business claims.

327.title: Win of democracy: Pilot on Kharge becoming new Congress chief
327.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Wednesday congratulated Mallikarjun Kharge on winning the party's Presidential poll. "Mallikarjun Kharge won with a huge majority, a win of democracy...I have faith [that] his experience will benefit the party," Pilot said. He added that 9,000 elected people elected the Congress President. "This was never done before by any party," he stated.

328.title: Mobility startup BeepKart raises $9 mn in Series A round
328.article_body: Online marketplace for sale and purchase of two-wheelers, BeepKart has raised $9 million in its Series A funding round led by Vertex Ventures along with participation from existing investors, Stellaris Venture Partners and Chiratae Ventures. The mobility startup was founded in 2020 by Hemir Doshi and Abhishek Saraf. In 2021, BeepKart had raised $3 million in seed funding.

329.title: Submit survey report of waterlogged roads in 2 days: PMC to officials
329.article_body: Pune Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar directed the Road Department officials to submit a survey report on waterlogging on Deccan, Jangali Maharaj and Fergusson College roads within two days. "Administration will check the stormwater drainage system...(and) any blockages," Kumar said. This comes after complaints about flooding of the roads due to works carried out under the Smart City project.

330.title: Bilkis Bano case convicts were out of jail for over 1,000 days each before release
330.article_body: A court document revealed that the 11 men sentenced to life imprisonment for the 2002 gangrape of Bilkis Bano were out of jail for more than 1,000 days each on parole. They were released for "good behaviour" by the Gujarat government on August 15, 2022. The CBI had opposed their release stating that their offence was "heinous, grave and serious".

331.title: Tom Felton shares struggles with substance abuse in 'Beyond The Wand'
331.article_body: 'Harry Potter' actor Tom Felton opened up about his substance abuse and mental health struggles in his memoir 'Beyond The Wand'. He confessed that his drinking habit got so bad that his manager, then-girlfriend as well as his agents had to intervene. "The habit spilled out of the bar and, from time to time, on to set," he added.

332.title: Bankrupt crypto firm Celsius faces US federal investigations: Report
332.article_body: Bankrupt crypto lender Celsius is facing US federal investigations, Bloomberg reported citing filing from lawyers. "Celsius is...subject to enforcement proceedings or investigations in at least 40 states, in addition to investigations...involving the federal government," filings mentioned. Creditors accused Celsius of misleading them about risks involved in entrusting their coins to the company.

333.title: IIT Hyd incubator launches 4-month programme for defence startups
333.article_body: IIT Hyderabad's iTIC Incubator in collaboration with Innovations for Defence Excellence - Defence Innovation Organisation (iDEX DIO) has launched a four-month-long programme to acclimatise defence startups with civilian technologies. In the first cohort of the programme, 10-12 startups will be selected. It was launched by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh at DefExpo 2022 Gandhinagar.

334.title: Rejected offers to play police inspector after 'Shola Aur...': Govvind
334.article_body: Actor Govvind Namdev has revealed he rejected several films with roles of police inspector after he did 'Shola Aur Shabnam' as he feared being typecast. He added people started calling him an egoist for refusing inspector roles at the start of the career. "I was under pressure...I managed to run my household by doing some theatre workshops...other gigs," he stated.

335.title: We owe irredeemable debt to Sonia Gandhi for her leadership: Tharoor
335.article_body: After Mallikarjun Kharge defeated Shashi Tharoor in the Congress President poll and became the party's new chief, Tharoor congratulated him and wished him success. "We owe an irredeemable debt to outgoing President Sonia Gandhi for leadership and for being anchor during most crucial moments," Tharoor said. Kharge became Congress' first non-Gandhi President in over two decades.

336.title: 3-yr-old who reported mother over candy gets chocolates, cycle from MP Minister
336.article_body: A three-year-old kid who reported his mother to the police for stealing his candies received chocolates and a bicycle from MP Home Minister Narottam Mishra. A video of the child complaining against his mother to police sub-inspector Priyanka Nayak surfaced on social media. He drew some lines when we asked him to sign on the complaint, Nayak said.

337.title: HDFC AMC's September quarter net profit surges by 6% to â¹364 crore
337.article_body: HDFC AMC posted a 6% surge in post-tax profit of â¹364 crore for the quarter ended September as against â¹344.4 crore a year ago. Revenue from operations saw a marginal increase of 0.4% at â¹544.7 crore. Its Quarterly Average Assets Under Management stood at â¹4.29 lakh crore as compared to â¹4.38 lakh crore in the year ago period.

338.title: 6 months in jail, â¹200 fine for bursting firecrackers on Diwali: Delhi minister
338.article_body: Bursting of firecrackers on Diwali in Delhi will attract a jail term of six months and a fine of â¹200, Environment Minister Gopal Rai said. Manufacturing, storing and selling firecrackers will attract three years in jail and a fine of up to â¹5,000, he added. The ban on firecrackers was re-imposed on September 7 till January 1, 2023.

339.title: Rupee dips below 83 against the US dollar for the first time
339.article_body: The Indian rupee dip below the 83 mark for the first time against the US dollar on Wednesday. The rupee closed at a record low of 83.01 (provisional) against the US dollar. The Indian rupee is down about 10% against the US dollar this year following the consistent strengthening of the greenback.

340.title: Sooraj Barjatya says he offered 'Main Prem Ki...' to Amitabh Bachchan
340.article_body: Director Sooraj Barjatya shared that he had pitched 'Main Prem Ki Diwani Hoon' (2003) to Amitabh Bachchan. Sharing the narration experience, Barjatya said, "He (Bachchan) listens 'apalak' (without blinking his eyes) and you cannot face the gaze. It's not easy." While Bachchan didn't feature in 'Main Prem Ki Diwani Hoon', it starred Abhishek Bachchan as one of the cast members.

341.title: Asia Cup title is history, we need to get into Super 12s of T20 WC: Dasun
341.article_body: Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said being the Asia Cup champions is history and their focus now is to enter the Super 12 stage of the ongoing T20 World Cup. "We're a far better team [than] the team we performed in the first game [against Namibia]," he added. SL will face the Netherlands in a must-win match on Thursday.

342.title: B'luru policeman books another policeman for wearing wrong helmet
342.article_body: A traffic police personnel of Bengaluru police booked another policeman for wearing a half helmet, which is prohibited on city roads. The policeman who was fined was driving a gearless scooter with a helmet that didn't fully cover his head. The RT Nagar Police shared the image of the two policemen on their Twitter handle.

343.title: Elon Musk's 'Burnt Hair' perfume sold out within 8 days of its launch
343.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk's 'Burnt Hair' perfume has sold out within eight days of its launch. "28,700 bottles of exquisite Burnt Hair perfume already sold! Only 1,300 left of this unique, limited edition collector's item," Musk had tweeted at 7:12 am on Wednesday. The perfume, priced at $100 (around â¹8,200), was launched on October 12.

344.title: SC grants interim bail to UP MLA Abbas Ansari in Arms Act case
344.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday granted interim bail to Uttar Pradesh MLA Abbas Ansari, son of gangster-turned-politician Mukhtar Ansari, in the Arms Act case filed against him. The court has directed the state government not to take coercive steps against Abbas till further orders. Abbas allegedly transferred an arms licence from Uttar Pradesh to Delhi without informing the Lucknow Police.

345.title: PM Modi to unveil 108-ft Kempegowda statue at B'luru airport on Nov 11
345.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will unveil a 108 feet bronze statue of Kempegowda at Bengaluru airport on November 11, said Karnataka Minister Dr CN Ashwathnarayan. The government is reportedly spending â¹85 crore on the Kempegowda statue which is made of bronze. The statue stands on a 23-acre space near the Kempegowda International Airport in Devanahalli.

346.title: Pernod Ricard delaying $244-mn tax demand probe: Indian authorities
346.article_body: The customs authority has asked a Mumbai court to quash Chivas Regal-maker Pernod Ricard's bid to halt proceedings related to a $244 million tax demand. The authority accused the French firm of being a "habitual litigant" and conspiring to "defraud" the government. This development comes amid Pernod Ricard facing business and regulatory stress in India, one of its key markets.
