347.title: 'Jai Jai Maharashtra Majha' to be state's official song: Minister
347.article_body: Maharashtra Cultural Affairs Minister Sudhir Mungantiwar on Tuesday said the state government has decided to adopt 'Jai Jai Maharashtra Majha' as the state's official song. "This song has warmth, emotion and spirit and we have decided to adopt it as the state's official song," Mungantiwar said. The state government is reportedly working on adopting two paragraphs of the song.

348.title: 2 men tonsured, garlanded with shoes & paraded in MP on panchayat's order
348.article_body: Two men were allegedly tonsured, garlanded with shoes, and paraded around in Madhya Pradesh's Daboha village on Monday, following an order by the gram panchayat. Police have arrested two accused in connection with the matter. The two men had reportedly hit one of the accused on his head during an argument sometime back, due to which he'd suffered serious injuries.

349.title: No cattle fest at Pushkar fair this year in view of lumpy skin disease
349.article_body: The Pushkar fair in Rajasthanâs Ajmer will be held without cattle fest this year following the spread of lumpy skin disease in Rajasthan. "Apart from this, all other religious and cultural events will be held. Preparations for fair are going in full swing," Sub-Divisional Magistrate, Sukhram Pindel, said. The fair will be held from November 1-7, an official release said.

350.title: Shaheen Afridi injures Afghan batter with yorker, teammate carries him on his back
350.article_body: Pakistan fast bowler Shaheen Afridi injured Afghanistan's 20-year-old opener Rahmanullah Gurbaz with a yorker. Facing his first delivery of the match, Gurbaz got hit on his toes and was adjudged LBW out. One of Afghanistan's players then carried Gurbaz out of the ground on his back. He was then taken to a nearby hospital for scans.

351.title: Jay Shah's comments can impact Pakistan's visit to India for World Cup 2023: PCB
351.article_body: Reacting to BCCI Secretary Jay Shah's comments that India won't travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023, the Pakistan Cricket Board said, "The overall impact of such statements has the potential to split Asian and international cricketing communities." It added, "It can impact Pakistan's visit to India for the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 and future ICC events in India."

352.title: Tharoor congratulates Congress President-elect Kharge, shares pics with him
352.article_body: After the poll results were declared, Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday shared pictures with Congress President-elect Mallikarjun Kharge. Tweeting the photos, Tharoor wrote, "Called on our new President-elect Mallikarjun Kharge to congratulate him and offer him my full co-operation. Congress has been strengthened by our contest." Notably, Kharge is the first non-Gandhi Congress chief in 24 years.

353.title: Govt releases city-wise list of timings of partial solar eclipse which will occur on Oct 25
353.article_body: The government has released the city-wise list of timings of partial solar eclipse which will occur on October 25. In Delhi, it will begin at 4.29 pm, while in Mumbai, it will begin at 4.49 pm. In Chennai and Bengaluru, it will begin at 5.14 pm and 5.12 pm, respectively. The ending of the eclipse won't be visible from India.

354.title: Mukesh Ambani buys Dubai's most expensive villa for $163 million: Report
354.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani bought a beach-side villa in Dubai's Palm Jumeirah for $163 million last week, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday. The latest purchase by Ambani has become Dubai's most expensive residential real estate deal. It comes months after the Ambanis purchased a beach-side villa in Palm Jumeirah for $80 million, which was Dubai's costliest home at the time.

355.title: Hackers claim to have customer data of Aus' Medibank, call for negotiations
355.article_body: Australia's Medibank Private Limited, on Wednesday, said that an unnamed hacker group claimed to have retrieved customer data from the former's IT systems and had contacted it to negotiate about the same. This development comes six days after Medibank reported an attempted ransomware attack on its network. However, there was no evidence that customer data had been removed, it said.

356.title: Delhi HC to hear pleas challenging 'Agnipath' scheme on Nov 18
356.article_body: Delhi High Court on Wednesday said that it will hear the pleas challenging the Centre's 'Agnipath' scheme on November 18. The Centre has filed a consolidated reply copy in the matters recently, Solicitor General Tushar Mehta informed HC. No prejudice has been caused to any of the candidates who had participated in the earlier recruitment process, the Centre told HC.

357.title: Helpline to complain about taxi, auto drivers refusing shorter rides launched in Mumbai
357.article_body: A helpline number, a WhatsApp chat service and an email for commuters to raise complaints against auto and taxi drivers who refuse short-distance trips have been launched in Mumbai. To lodge a complaint, citizens can call or drop a WhatsApp message at (+91)8454999999, an official said. People can also drop an email to mh01taxicomplaint@gmail.com to register issues.

358.title: Beating of protester at Chinese consulate was unacceptable: UK Minister
358.article_body: British Foreign Secretary James Cleverly has said that the treatment of a pro-democracy Hong Kong protester, who was beaten up after being pulled into the grounds of a Chinese consulate, was unacceptable and the government was considering further action. The altercation happened on Sunday during a demonstration against Chinese President Xi Jinping in Manchester.

359.title: 66-yr-old domestic help falls from window on 2nd floor in Mumbai, dies
359.article_body: A 66-year-old domestic help died after falling from an apartment window on the second floor in Mumbai's Mulund on Monday. Police said Sulochana Lakshman Sostche had stepped on the window's grille for cleaning purposes when both she and the grille dropped down to the ground. "Her body was lying in a pool of blood," a resident of the building said.

360.title: Microsoft acquires 10.89 lakh sq ft of commercial plot in Pune
360.article_body: Microsoft Corporation (India) has acquired 10.89 lakh sq ft of commercial plot at Pimpri Waghere in Pune from Finolex Industries for a consolidated amount of â¹328.84 crore, reports said. Microsoft is reportedly planning to develop a large hyperscale data centre at the location. Microsoft will hold the lease rights for the land for the next 37 years.

361.title: Tamil Nadu Assembly passes bill to ban online gambling games
361.article_body: Tamil Nadu Assembly on Wednesday passed a bill to ban online gambling games and regulate other online games. The bill was introduced by the state's Law Minister S Regupathy. Last year, the government had amended the Tamil Nadu Gaming and Police Laws concerning the ban on online gaming. However, Madras HC struck down the amendment because they found it unconstitutional.

362.title: I think comments about being tired were taken in wrong way: Adam Zampa
362.article_body: Australia's Adam Zampa has said their captain Aaron Finch's recent comment about the team being "tired" was taken in the wrong way. "I think the intensity of the cricket we've played recently has probably dropped...[because] we're keeping in mind how close WC is," clarified Zampa. Australia will play their opening game at the T20 WC on October 22 against NZ.

363.title: Mother Sparsh raises â¹13.50 crore from ITC, plans to raise â¹100 crore
363.article_body: ITC said it has invested â¹13.50 in baby care brand Mother Sparsh, which is in talks with other investors to raise â¹90-100 crore in Series B funding. According to its regulatory filing, ITC's share in Mother Sparsh will go up to 22% with the investment. Mother Sparsh said it intends to enhance its portfolio, especially across baby-care and mother-oriented segment.

364.title: Video shows B'luru airport's Terminal 2 features days before inauguration
364.article_body: Days before the inauguration of Terminal 2 at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport, videos of it have gone viral on social media platforms. An 84-second video showed some features of the terminal, which will be inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi on November 11. "The terminal is nothing short of a masterpiece," said Industries Minister Murugesh Nirani.

365.title: Russian-installed official in Kherson tells residents to evacuate
365.article_body: A Russian-installed official Kirill Stremousov told civilians in the Russian-controlled Ukrainian city of Kherson that they should evacuate as soon as possible as Ukrainian forces could begin counter-offensive. In the last few weeks, Russian forces in Kherson have been driven back by 20-30 km. The commander of Russian forces in Ukraine Sergei Surovikin said the situation in Kherson is "difficult".

366.title: Kharge won against Tharoor with 8 times more votes: Congress MP
366.article_body: Reacting to Mallikarjun Kharge's victory in the Congress Presidential election, party MP Pramod Tiwari said that Kharge won the election with eight times more votes than his competitor Shashi Tharoor. Sharing the vote count, he said, Kharge got 7,897 votes while Shashi Tharoor got about 1,000 votes. Shashi Tharoor congratulated Mallikarjun Kharge for his victory.

367.title: US, S Korean troops stage river-crossing drills as N Korea protests
367.article_body: US and South Korean troops on Wednesday practiced building floating bridges to ferry tanks and other armoured vehicles across rivers as part of a larger joint military exercise. North Korea has condemned the drills for raising tensions and test-fired rockets and artillery in response. The drills are defensive and necessary for deterring Pyongyang, the US and South Korea said.

368.title: Rupee hits new all-time low, slips to 82.77 against US dollar
368.article_body: The Indian rupee touched a fresh all-time low of 82.77 against the US dollar on Wednesday. The rupee slipped 10 paise to end at 82.40 against the dollar on Tuesday. It opened 0.03% higher at 82.33 against the American currency on Wednesday morning. The rupee's previous record low was 82.72, which it hit on October 10.

369.title: 6 am-8 am gang looting homes with doors left open for milk, newspaper in Mumbai
369.article_body: A gang consisting of two women, a boy and a girl have been stealing mobile phones, cash, gold or any other valuable from households that left their doors open for milkmen and newspapers in Mumbai. They mostly operate between 6 am and 8 am. Several thefts were reported in chawls and societies without security guards between Dadar and Byculla recently.

370.title: Ludhiana man poses as police personnel, cheats families of arrested persons
370.article_body: Police arrested a 28-year-old man posing as police personnel in Ludhiana for allegedly cheating family members of people arrested by the police in different criminal cases on the promise of ensuring their release from police custody. His aide is yet to be arrested. They used to target families of the arrested individuals outside various city police stations.

371.title: Umran is real talent, I'm happy that he's not in India's squad: Waqar Younis
371.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Waqar Younis has termed India pacer Umran Malik as a "real talent", stating that he's happy that the 22-year-old is not part of India's squad for the T20 World Cup. "If [you] have pace, everything will go right," added Waqar. Umran made his India debut against Ireland earlier this year and has played three T20Is so far.

372.title: Local trains going towards Mumbai's Churchgate delayed due to technical snag
372.article_body: Local trains on the suburban line of Western Railway coming towards Churchgate are running late by 10-15 minutes due to a technical snag at Borivali station, a railway official said. Meanwhile, many commuters took to social media to complain about the trains being late. "Every day trains running 20 to 30 minutes [late] on western line," a Twitter user wrote.

373.title: Girl killed, boy's arm severed as bike hits barrier at 120 kmph in B'luru
373.article_body: An 18-year-old's sports bike hit a crash barrier on Kempegowda International Airport Road in Bengaluru, killing his female friend and leaving him with a severed arm on his birthday. According to police sources, the boy had borrowed the sports bike from his friend and was riding it at a speed of about 120 km per hour when he lost balance.

374.title: Parents of former Italian PM Renzi acquitted in invoice charge case
374.article_body: An Italian appeals court has acquitted the parents of ex-PM Matteo Renzi who were accused of issuing false invoices for $176,000 in 2015. They were found guilty in 2019. "After years of struggle and pain, my parents were acquitted...I don't wish anyone to live through what my parents had to live through, they didn't deserve so much hate," Renzi tweeted.

375.title: Netflix shares jump 14% as it adds 2.4 million subscribers in Q3
375.article_body: Nasdaq-listed shares of Netflix jumped over 14% in after-hours trading on Tuesday after the company disclosed it gained 2.4 million subscribers globally in the third quarter. Its revenue also increased 6% year-over-year to $7.9 billion in the quarter. The streaming company had lost nearly one million subscribers in the previous quarter and 200,000 subscribers in the first quarter.

376.title: Virgin Orbit to do 1st launch from Europe within 6 weeks: Branson
376.article_body: Billionaire Richard Branson on Tuesday said that his small satellite service provider Virgin Orbit will be doing its "first launch from European soil into space within the next six weeks". The launch will be conducted from UK's Cornwall. Branson further stated, "Virgin Orbit can launch satellites into space from anywhere in the world into any orbit at a [day's] notice."

377.title: BJP releases first list of 62 candidates for Himachal Pradesh polls
377.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Wednesday released the first list of 62 candidates for the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls, fielding CM Jairam Thakur from Seraj constituency. Himachal's Urban Development Minister Suresh Bhardwaj has been fielded from Kasumpti instead of Shimla Urban, where BJP state treasurer Sanjay Sood will contest from. The party has denied tickets to 11 sitting MLAs.

378.title: Ireland record their highest successful run chase in T20 World Cup history
378.article_body: Ireland on Wednesday recorded their highest successful run chase in T20 World Cup history. Ireland chased down a target of 177 in 19 overs against Scotland in their first round match. Ireland's previous highest successful run chase in T20 World Cup had come in the 2014 edition, when they chased down a 164-run target against Zimbabwe.

379.title: Who are the top 5 all-rounders in T20I cricket as Shakib reclaims top spot?
379.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings forÂ T20I all-rounders. Bangladesh's Shakib Al Hasan has reclaimed the top spot, while Afghanistan's Mohammad Nabi is ranked second. Nabi is followed by England's Moeen Ali and Namibia's Johannes Jonathan Smit. Sri Lanka's Wanindu Hasaranga is the fifth-ranked all-rounder. Meanwhile, Hardik Pandya is the highest-ranked Indian all-rounder at sixth position.

380.title: Free gift offers can be Chinese websites stealing information, warns govt
380.article_body: The government's CERT-In has warned that fake messages are in circulation on platforms like WhatsApp, Telegram and Instagram that falsely claim a festive offer luring users into gifts and prizes. These messages contain links to phishing websites that mostly have Chinese [.cn] domains. The attackers can entice users into sharing their bank details and other personal information, CERT-In warned.

381.title: I refuse to list my PhD among my qualifications, it's useless: Zoho CEO
381.article_body: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu in a series of tweets said that he refuses to list his PhD among his qualifications because he doesn't value that work and considers it "useless". He said, "Professors were addicted to the models themselves and never entertained any doubts about whether the models had much to do with reality."

382.title: SC refuses to list urgent plea seeking stay on release of Ajay Devgn's Thank God
382.article_body: Supreme Court has refused to list the urgent plea filed by Shri Chitragupta Welfare Trust that sought a stay on Thank God's release. The court listed the petition for November 1, while the film is scheduled to release on October 25. When the Trust's advocate stated that the petition will be "infructuous" by then, the court said, "let it be".

383.title: Drug addict's body with stab wounds found on Mumbai railway tracks
383.article_body: The body of a 25-year-old man with multiple stab wounds was found on the railway tracks near Mumbai's Kurla railway station on Tuesday. Injuries inflicted from sharp weapons were found on the man's neck and chest. The deceased, Nikhil Sawala, was a resident of Ghatkopar. According to the Government Railway Police (GRP), Nikhil was a drug addict.

384.title: 14.5 kg of smack worth â¹15 cr seized from car in MP, 1 arrested
384.article_body: Police arrested a 25-year-old alleged drug trafficker in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch and seized 14.5 kilograms of smack worth about â¹15 crore from a car he was travelling in. The consignment was brought from Assam and was being taken to Rajasthan's Pratapgarh, an official said. Police acted on a tip-off, intercepted the car and found the smack in 15 packets.

385.title: AAP office attacked in Mumbai, party's Mumbai Prez blames Cong, BJP
385.article_body: AAP's Mumbai office was allegedly attacked on Tuesday night, with the party's city President Preeti Sharma claiming that Congress and BJP were behind it, as they have been feeling threatened by its growth. In a press release, AAP alleged that BJP's ranks are filled with anti-social elements, adding that Congress is finished and the corrupt leaders are joining BJP.

386.title: Revival of our party has begun today: Tharoor after losing to Kharge in Cong Prez poll
386.article_body: Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday conceded defeat in Congress Presidential election. Sharing a note on Twitter, he congratulated Mallikarjun Kharge for his victory and said, "I believe the revival of our party has truly begun today." Kharge, who will be the first non-Gandhi to hold the post in over two decades, received 7,897 votes while Tharoor trailed behind with 1,072 votes.

387.title: Australia investigating reports that its pilots trained Chinese military
387.article_body: Australia's Defence Minister Richard Marles has asked defence department to investigate reports that its former pilots were accepting training roles in China. This comes after British government said it was taking steps to stop China from recruiting British military pilots to train Chinese armed forces. Thirty former UK military pilots had gone to China to train its army, BBC reported.

388.title: 10 UP cities including Gorakhpur selected for Smart Cities Mission: UP CM
388.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said that with PM Narendra Modiâs inspiration, UPâs 10 cities have been selected for the Smart Cities Mission. The 10 cities include Gorakhpur. "Everyone needs to become smart with a smart city and promote cleanliness," CM Yogi said. "Many development projects have given a new identity to Gorakhpur," he added.

389.title: UK inflation surges to 10.1% in September, back to 40-year high
389.article_body: British consumer price inflation surged by 10.1% in annual terms in September, which is the biggest jump in food prices since 1980. It matched the 40-year high, it hit in July, data from the Office for National Statistics (ONS) showed on Wednesday. Prices of food and non-alcoholic beverages led the inflation in September as they rose by 14.5%.

390.title: Power cuts in parts of Bengaluru from October 20 to 22
390.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will face power cuts from October 20 to October 22 as Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) and Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation will be undertaking some maintenance works. Most of these outages might occur between 10 am and 4 pm. BESCOM divisions which will remain affected tomorrow are - Ramanagara, HSR Layout, Kengeri, Jalahalli, Peenya and Bagalakunte.

391.title: SpiceJet hikes salaries for captains to â¹7 lakh per month from November
391.article_body: SpiceJet has announced an increase in the salary for its captains with effect from November. The revised salary will amount to â¹7 lakh per month for 80 hours of flying, the airline said in an official statement. The low-cost carrier said that it has been revising salaries for its pilots on a monthly basis.

392.title: Mallikarjun Kharge becomes Congress' 1st non-Gandhi President in over 20 years
392.article_body: Mallikarjun Kharge became Congress' first non-Gandhi President in over two decades on Wednesday. Kharge defeated Shashi Tharoor in the Congress President poll which was held on Monday. Kharge will replace interim Congress chief Sonia Gandhi, who has been occupying the post ever since Rahul Gandhi stepped down after the 2019 Lok Sabha elections.

393.title: Bilkis Bano case convict accused of molesting woman while out on parole in 2020
393.article_body: One of the 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case, 57-year-old Mitesh Bhatt, was accused of assaulting a woman with the intention of outraging her modesty when he was out on parole in June 2020, as per an affidavit of the Gujarat government. The 11 of them were released from prison on August 15 "on account of good behaviour".

394.title: 2nd phase of 'Mahakal Lok' project begins: MP CM Shivraj Chouhan
394.article_body: MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said work on the second phase of the 'Mahakal Lok' project in MPâs Ujjain city has started. The work includes renovation of ancient temples and heritage structures and restoration of the Chhota Rudra Sagar lake, Chouhan added. After the completion of the second phase works, it will be transformed into âShri Mahakal Mahalok", he stated.

395.title: Nestle India's Q3 profit rises 8.3% to â¹668 cr, revenue up 18.3%
395.article_body: Nestle India posted an 8.3% rise in net profit at â¹668 crore for the September quarter as against â¹617 crore a year ago. Its revenue surged 18.3% to â¹4,591 crore. It witnessed the highest sales growth during a quarter in the last five years. The Maggi-maker announced a second interim dividend of â¹120 per equity share amounting to â¹1,157 crore.

396.title: Kangana Ranaut to play theatre actor Noti Binodini in her next film
396.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut will be seen playing Bengali theatre superstar Noti Binodini in her upcoming film, which will be directed by Pradeep Sarkar. On Instagram, Kangana shared Binodini's picture and wrote that she "was the first female actress in British-occupied India" who "renounced everything and became a saint" after achieving success. "I'm very happy for this opportunity," Kangana added.

397.title: I'm seeing only Bhuvneshwar: Aakash on bowler Shami can replace in playing XI
397.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has suggested that Mohammad Shami can replace Bhuvneshwar Kumar in India's playing XI in the T20 World Cup. "Shami will definitely bowl better than Bhuvneshwar at the death...Harshal's form [is] fifty-fifty...[and] we have placed a lot of hope on Arshdeep, so maybe that's the only change I'm thinking of at this point in time," he explained.

398.title: Cyber criminals cheat woman over job in airline company in Pune
398.article_body: Cyber criminals cheated a woman over a false promise of a job in a private airline company in Pune, police said. The complainant came in contact with the fraudsters, including a woman, through a web portal in September 2020, Pimpri-Chinchwad Police added. The accused also asked the woman to transfer â¹11,500 into a bank account for the job.

399.title: Mumbai's Jagat Vidya road to be closed for 5 months starting today
399.article_body: The Jagat Vidya road in Mumbai's Kherwadi traffic division will be closed for five months in view of the drainage line work from Guru Nanak Hospital Chowk to the Bombay Bank Building. These arrangements will be in effect for five months from 12 am on October 19, 2022, to 12 am on March 18, 2023, the Mumbai Traffic Police said.

400.title: US to make it harder for Iran to sell drones to Russia with 'aggressive steps'
400.article_body: The US has said that it will continue to take "practical, aggressive" steps including sanctions and export control actions to make it harder for Iran to sell drones and missiles to Russia. "Russia deepening an alliance with Iran is something the entire world...should view as a profound threat," US State Department Principal Deputy Spokesperson Vedant Patel said.

401.title: Shashi Tharoor writes to Congress poll body, alleges 'serious irregularities' in UP
401.article_body: Shashi Tharoor has written to the Congress' Central Election Authority, alleging "extremely serious irregularities" in the conduct of the party's presidential election process in Uttar Pradesh. The letter stated problems like unofficial seals for ballot boxes, the presence of unofficial people in polling booths and voting malpractice. He added that "all votes from UP be deemed invalid."
